original: bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: ces bya bas ston pas smod pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas ston pas smod pa bstan te /

analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims nyams par gyur pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang gang zag 'di ni nyes par byed pa ste /

original: chos mthun rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi //
analyzed: chos mthun rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi //
translated: The wise, the companions in the celibate life,

original: sman dang zhes bya bas /

analyzed: mkhas pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis smod par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the wise, the companions in the celibate life, criticize him.

original: bslab pa nyams pa de la sde snod gsum la mkhas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang bdag cag gi grogs po 'di ni sdig pa'i lam du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi
analyzed: bslab pa nyams pa de la sde snod gsum la mkhas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis kyang bdag cag gi grogs po 'di ni sdig pa'i lam du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi
translated: This friend of ours has impaired the training of the Tathagata's Excellent Words by engaging in a path of evil.

analyzed: bslab pa las nyams pa yin no zhes smod cing 'dul ba dang gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du bskrad pa la sogs pa'i las kyang byed do //

analyzed: 'jig rten mi snyan sgrogs zhes bya bas phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang sdig pa mi snyan par grags par 'gyur ba bstan te /

analyzed: bslab pa nyams pa'i gang zag de la kun gyis kyang mi snyan par sgrogs par 'gyur te /

original: phyogs bcu kun tu yang gang zag che ge mo zhig ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta bu dag byed pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa kun 'phya zhing smod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun tu yang gang zag che ge mo zhig ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta bu dag byed pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa kun 'phya zhing smod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all the ten directions, people will say, ‚ÄúSo and so is doing this sort of evil, nonvirtuous deed,‚Äù and they will all laugh at and criticize him.

original: 'di yan chad kyis tshe 'di la kha na ma tho ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis tshe 'di la kha na ma tho ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the text has explained the arising of misdeeds in this life.

original: gzhan yang @85a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @85a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: phyir zhing mi khom skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir zhing mi khom skye bar 'gyur //

original: zhes bya bas tshe phyi mar kha na ma tho ba skye par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas tshe phyi mar kha na ma tho ba skye par bstan te /
translated: This shows the arising of misdeeds in future lives.

original: tshe 'dir kha na ma tho ba skye bar yang ma zad tshe rabs gzhan du yang gar skyes gar skyes kyang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa mi khom pa brgyad kyi gnas su skye bar 'gyur te /

translated: Not only will he give rise to misdeeds in this life, but in other lives as well, wherever he is born, he will be born in the eight places lacking freedom, such as the hells.

original: de ni tshe phyi mar kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshe phyi mar kha na ma tho ba 'phel ba yin no //
translated: This is the increase of misdeeds in future lives.

original: dge ba yi ni chos rnams kyang //
analyzed: dge ba yi ni chos rnams kyang //
translated: Even the virtuous qualities

analyzed: thob dang ma thob nyams par 'gyur / zhes bya bas tshe 'di dang phyi mar kha na ma tho ba skye bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the person who is without shame and embarassment generates demerit in this life and the next.

original: ngo tsha ba med pa'i gang zag gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas na sngon dad pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos yod pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba med pa'i gang zag gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas na sngon dad pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos yod pa yang med par 'gyur te /

original: de ni dge ba'i chos thob pa las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i chos thob pa las nyams pa'o //

analyzed: tshe phyi mar yang dad pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos thob par 'gyur ba yang mi thob par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ni dge ba'i chos ma thob pa las nyams pa'o //

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gnas pa dang // yid la mi bde gnas pa 'thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gnas pa dang // yid la mi bde gnas pa 'thob //üîΩces bya ba la /

original: de ltar bdag la gnod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / tshe 'dir kha na ma tho ba skye ba dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyi gar kha na ma tho ba skyes pas rtag tu yang lus sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang /üîΩsems sdug bsngal bar gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag la gnod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / tshe 'dir kha na ma tho ba skye ba dang / tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyi gar kha na ma tho ba skyes pas rtag tu yang lus sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / sems sdug bsngal bar gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one always experiences physical pain and mental pain, due to the arising of the demerit that injures oneself, that injures others, that injures both, that injures this life, and that injures both this life and the next.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyis mi bde ba myong bar ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyis mi bde ba myong bar ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the experience of pain by the five groups of consciousnesses, from visual consciousness to tactile consciousness, is called suffering.

original: yid kyi rnam pa la mi bde ba myong ba ni yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam pa la mi bde ba myong ba ni yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis ngo tsha ba dang khrel ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyes pa bstan to //

analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag thams cad ni //

analyzed: khrel ldan rgyal sras rnam mi 'byung //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the verse,

analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i nyes pa dag la gnod pa byas pa nas yid la mi bde bar gnas pa thob pa de dag thams cad khrel ba dang ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mi 'byung ste /
translated: all the faults taught above, from the harm done to the bodhisattva to the abiding in mental unhappiness, do not occur for the bodhisattva who has a sense of shame and self-respect.

analyzed: de ni ngo tsha ba'i yon tan no // mkhas pa mi dang lha rnams su //
translated: This is the quality of self-respect.üîΩThe wise are always well born

analyzed: @85b de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o // blo ldan byang chub tshogs de na //

analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' khrel ba dang ldan zhing ngo tsha ba yod pa ste /

analyzed: khrel ba dang ngo tsha ba'i dbang gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs myur du rdzogs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin bya la // rgyal sras mnyam pa med par 'gyur //
translated: In bringing beings to maturity,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the victors‚Äô spiritual heir is unrivaled.

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshe rabs gar skyes na yang theg pa gsum du sems can 'god cing smin par bya ba la skyo ba med de ;

analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan thams cad du ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni khrel med cing ngo tsha ba mi shes pa dang phral bar 'gyur te /

original: de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: khrel med cing ngo tsha ba med pa'i gnyen po ni khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba yod pa ste /

analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba yod pa dang mi 'brel bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o // yon tan ngo tsha thob gyur pa //

analyzed: de ni rgyal ba'i sras rnams so //

analyzed: zhes bya bas ngo tsha ba'i yon tan mdor bsdus nas bstan te //
translated: This verse summarizes the qualities of a sense of shame.

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba'i sras rnams ni gong du bshad pa'i nyes pa thams cad kyang mi 'byung la /

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'bras bu lnga'i yon tan yang 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five verses beginning with

analyzed: nyes pas dri ma can du byas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa lngas //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ras dang snam bu la g-yogs pa'i gos pas byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i gos khyad zhugs pa bsten te /

translated: Even though fools, ordinary people, are covered with clothes to hide their unattractive bodies and to keep their bodies from being soiled by dust, etc.,

original: ngo tsha ba med cing khrel med pas na nang gi sems @86a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba med cing khrel med pas na nang gi sems @86a * //
translated: because they are shameless and without embarrassment, their inner minds are soiled by the stains of the mental afflictions.

analyzed: la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas dri ma can du byas pas na lus dri ma med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the body is made dirty by stains such as attachment, it is not stainless.üîΩThe cloth of the victors‚Äô heirs

original: rgyal sras gos ni ngo tsha bas //üîΩg-yogs pa med kyang nyes dri bral //
analyzed: rgyal sras gos ni ngo tsha bas // g-yogs pa med kyang nyes dri bral //
translated: is modesty and shame,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: even when they are not covered, they are free from the stain of faults.

analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gos ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa ste /
translated: The cloth of the bodhisattvas, the victors‚Äô heirs, is modesty and shame.

translated: Since they are not sullied by the stains of attachment, anger, and so on, and by killing, stealing, and so on, they are called stainless.

translated: The meaning of this verse and the verse that follows is that ordinary beings, even though covered with cloth,

original: rdul la sogs pa'i phyi'i dri mas mi gos kyang ;
analyzed: rdul la sogs pa'i phyi'i dri mas mi gos kyang ;
translated: are not covered with the external stains of dust, etc.

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtag tu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nang gi dri ma can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: khrel yod rgyal sras nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: khrel yod rgyal sras nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: The bodhisattvas shame is like the sky,

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan te /

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i chos kyang rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' bzhin du dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: And the qualities of shame and abashment are by nature pure like space.

original: khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bsod snyoms la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang ma grags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mgos te /üîΩrnyed na yang dga' ba mi skye /üîΩma rnyed na yang mi dga' ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bsod snyoms la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang ma grags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mgos te / rnyed na yang dga' ba mi skye / ma rnyed na yang mi dga' ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: So when bodhisattvas who have a sense of shame and decency are practicing generosity and so on, they are not affected by the eight worldly concerns, such as gain and loss, fame and obscurity.üîΩEven if they do not obtain anything, they are not unhappy.

original: sten cing 'grogs pa'i rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: sten cing 'grogs pa'i rgyal sras rnams //
translated: And even if they do obtain something, they are not happy.üîΩThe buddhas' heirs, who rely on and associate with shame,

original: ngo tshas brgyan pa mdzes pa bzhin //
analyzed: ngo tshas brgyan pa mdzes pa bzhin //
translated: are as beautiful as if adorned with ornaments.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rgyan dang 'dra bar bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rgyan dang 'dra bar bstan te /
translated: This shows that shame and decency are like ornaments.

original: dper na skye bo la la zhig rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan te grogs ma 'gro ba mang po'i nang du mdzes pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na skye bo la la zhig rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan te grogs ma 'gro ba mang po'i nang du mdzes pa bzhin du /
translated: It is like someone who is adorned with various ornaments and is beautiful in the midst of a crowd of friends.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khrel yod pa dang ngo @86b tsha ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa de yang rgyal ba'i sras rang gi grogs su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dbus su song na mdzes pa dang bzang bar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khrel yod pa dang ngo @86b tsha ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa de yang rgyal ba'i sras rang gi grogs su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dbus su song na mdzes pa dang bzang bar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And the bodhisattva who is adorned with the ornament of conscience and shame is beautiful and good when he goes into the midst of the assembly of bodhisattvas, who are his companions in the Conqueror's lineage.

original: ma bzhin byams pa 'dul ba la //
analyzed: ma bzhin byams pa 'dul ba la //
translated: Conscience is like a mother,

original: khrel yod byang chub sems dpa' rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dis /
analyzed: khrel yod byang chub sems dpa' rnams // zhes bya ba 'dis /
translated: for taming the bodhisattvas.

original: khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba 'jig rten gyi ma dang 'dra bar bstan te /
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha ba 'jig rten gyi ma dang 'dra bar bstan te /
translated: This verse shows that conscience and shame are like a mother in the world.

original: dper na 'jig rten gyi ma bu la byams pa dang gces pa dang sdug par byed de bu btang snyoms su mi 'dor ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten gyi ma bu la byams pa dang gces pa dang sdug par byed de bu btang snyoms su mi 'dor ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, a mother in the world loves her children, cherishes them, and cares for them, and does not abandon them.

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad la bu dang 'dra bar byams pa dang gces pa dang phangs pa byed de sems can yal bar mi 'dor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad la bu dang 'dra bar byams pa dang gces pa dang phangs pa byed de sems can yal bar mi 'dor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva who has a sense of shame and decency also loves all sentient beings as if they were his children, cherishes them, and holds them dear, and does not abandon them.

original: bskyab par rigs pa'i sems can rnams btang snyoms su byed na ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskyab par rigs pa'i sems can rnams btang snyoms su byed na ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It would be shameful to be indifferent to sentient beings who should be protected.

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa ma lta bur gzhag pa ni gal te sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bskyab cing bsgral ba'i rigs pa dang btang snyoms su bor te bsgral na byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa ma lta bur gzhag pa ni gal te sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bskyab cing bsgral ba'i rigs pa dang btang snyoms su bor te bsgral na byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The sense of shame and decency that is like a mother is presented as follows: If it is right to protect and liberate sentient beings from the sufferings of cyclic existence, and if one does not liberate them but abandons them, the bodhisattva experiences a sense of shame.

original: de bas na btang snyoms su mi 'dor ba'i phyir ma dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad las //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms su mi 'dor ba'i phyir ma dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to // 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad las //
translated: Therefore, because one does not abandon them, it is like a mother.üîΩIt protects from all the faults of cyclic existence.

original: khrel yod pa na srung bar byed //
analyzed: khrel yod pa na srung bar byed //
translated: It is a sense of shame.

original: ces bya ba 'dis /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis /
translated: This verse shows

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rta dang glang po la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba bstan te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rta dang glang po la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba bstan te /
translated: The analogy of shame and embarrassment as a horse, elephant, etc.

original: dper na rta dang glang po che dang dpung bu chung la sogs pa dmag gi tshogs kyis rgyal srid dang yul phyogs dgras mi 'phrogs par srung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rta dang glang po che dang dpung bu chung la sogs pa dmag gi tshogs kyis rgyal srid dang yul phyogs dgras mi 'phrogs par srung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a king‚Äôs realm and territory are protected from being plundered by enemies by an army of horses, elephants, infantry, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i dmag gis kyang 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar srung bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i dmag gis kyang 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar srung bar byed do //
translated: so also the bodhisattva‚Äôs army of shame and embarrassment protects him from falling under the power of enemies, the afflictions, such as attachment, etc., when he is working for the welfare of living beings in cyclic existence.

original: gos pa la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gos pa la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: These analogies of clothing, etc.

original: gos kyi dpe dang / nam mkha'i dpe dang / rgyan gyi dpe dang / mi'i dpe dang / rta dang glang po'i dpe lngas ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel ba'i don rnam pa lnga byed par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gos kyi dpe dang / nam mkha'i dpe dang / rgyan gyi dpe dang / mi'i dpe dang / rta dang glang po'i dpe lngas ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel ba'i don rnam pa lnga byed par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five similes of clothing, space, jewelry, a human being, and horses and elephants illustrate the five kinds of functions of conscience and shame.

original: gnas pa la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase in regard to the stations, as the antidote to the defilements means the following:

original: gnas pa ni skyil mo krung bcas nas rnal 'byor yid la byed pa bsgom pa la bya ste /üîΩgos kyi dpes ni byang chub sems @87a * //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skyil mo krung bcas nas rnal 'byor yid la byed pa bsgom pa la bya ste / gos kyi dpes ni byang chub sems @87a * //
translated: The stations are the postures of sitting cross-legged and cultivating the yoga of mental attention.

original: dpa' rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa'i tshe na ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i chos nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i gnyen po byed par bstan to //
analyzed: dpa' rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i bsgom pa'i tshe na ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i chos nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i gnyen po byed par bstan to //
translated: The simile of clothing illustrates the fact that when the bodhisattva is cultivating the yoga of mental attention, conscience and shame are the antidote to the arising of the defilements.

original: spyod pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi gnyen po dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi gnyen po dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase in regard to conduct, as the antidote to worldly dharmas means the following:

original: spyod pa ni grong du bsod snyoms len pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni grong du bsod snyoms len pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The conduct is the going to the village to collect alms, and so on.üîΩ üîΩThe simile of space illustrates the fact that conscience and shame are the antidote to the defilements of the bodhisattva who is engaged in conduct.

original: nam mkha'i dpes ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa de bsod snyoms la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dpes ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa de bsod snyoms la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: The example of space shows that shame and abashment are the antidote to being sullied by the eight worldly dharmas, such as gain and loss, when one is practicing in the manner of a beggar.

original: chos can gnas mthun pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos can gnas mthun pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having a similar Dharma and a similar station.

original: chos can gyi chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i grogs la bya ste /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i grogs la bya ste /
translated: This refers to a bodhisattva‚Äôs companions who have similar Dharma and similar conduct.

original: rgyan gyi dpes ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi nang na gnas kyang de dag dang spyod pa mthun zhing mdzes par gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyan gyi dpes ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi nang na gnas kyang de dag dang spyod pa mthun zhing mdzes par gnas pa bstan to //
translated: The example of an ornament shows that if one has shame and abashment, one will live in harmony with the bodhisattvas‚Äô activities and live beautifully among the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mthun pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mthun pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having a similar way of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa de sems can yongs su smin pa dang mthun par bstan te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa de sems can yongs su smin pa dang mthun par bstan te /
translated: This shows that shame and abashment are in harmony with bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: dper na mas bu yal bar mi 'dor ba bzhin du ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa dang ldan par gyur na yang sems can yal bar mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mas bu yal bar mi 'dor ba bzhin du ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa dang ldan par gyur na yang sems can yal bar mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just as a mother does not abandon her child, one who is endowed with shame and abashment does not abandon sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba dang mthun par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba dang mthun par zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without afflictions, one engages samsara.

original: rta dang glang po'i dpe ni sems can gyi don 'khor bar 'jug kyang 'khor ba na nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: rta dang glang po'i dpe ni sems can gyi don 'khor bar 'jug kyang 'khor ba na nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The examples of the horse and elephant show that one who is endowed with shame and abashment engages samsara without afflictions.

original: dper na glang po la sogs pas yul srung bar byed pa bzhin du khrel ba dang ngo tsha bas zin na 'khor ba na gnas kyang byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos par srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na glang po la sogs pas yul srung bar byed pa bzhin du khrel ba dang ngo tsha bas zin na 'khor ba na gnas kyang byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos par srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just as a king protects his realm with elephants and so on, one who is endowed with shame and abashment abides in samsara but is not sullied by attachment and so on, since the bodhisattva protects.

original: kun la bzod par mi 'gyur dang // kun la bzod cing 'jug pa dang // thams cad la yang 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: kun la bzod par mi 'gyur dang // kun la bzod cing 'jug pa dang // thams cad la yang 'jug pa ste //
translated: Patience with regard to all, patience in engaging all, and patience in all.

original: khrel yod ngo tshas bskyed pa'i mtshan //
analyzed: khrel yod ngo tshas bskyed pa'i mtshan //
translated: These are the characteristics generated by shame and abashment.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha ba las mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi skye ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha ba las mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi skye ste /
translated: This shows that the four signs arise from shame and modesty.

original: mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi snang na byang chub sems dpa' khrel ba dang ngo tsha ba'i chos yod par rig par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi snang na byang chub sems dpa' khrel ba dang ngo tsha ba'i chos yod par rig par bya bar bstan to //
translated: When the four signs appear, it shows that the bodhisattva has the qualities of shame and modesty.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs khrel med pa dang ngo tsha ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyes @87b pa sems la byung na bzod par mi byed de myur du spong bar byed de /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs khrel med pa dang ngo tsha ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyes @87b pa sems la byung na bzod par mi byed de myur du spong bar byed de /
translated: Therein, when shamelessness and lack of modesty, and the faults of desire, hatred, etc., arise in the mind, he does not tolerate them but quickly gets rid of them.

original: de ni mtshan ma gcig go //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma gcig go //
translated: This is the first sign.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan sems la byung na bzod cing sems la 'jog par byed de //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan sems la byung na bzod cing sems la 'jog par byed de //
translated: When the virtues of generosity, morality, etc. arise in the mind, he tolerates them and keeps them in mind.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second sign.

original: phyis kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad la mi 'jug mi byed de //
analyzed: phyis kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad la mi 'jug mi byed de //
translated: Later on, he does not engage in or perform any sinful, unwholesome dharmas.

original: de ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third sign.

original: dge ba dang yon tan gyi chos ma bsgrubs pa rnams la sgrub cing 'jug par byed de //
analyzed: dge ba dang yon tan gyi chos ma bsgrubs pa rnams la sgrub cing 'jug par byed de //
translated: He causes those who have not practiced virtuous and good qualities to practice and engage in them.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi ba ste /
translated: This is the fourth sign.

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa las skyes pa'i mtshan ma bzhi snang na ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa thob par rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa las skyes pa'i mtshan ma bzhi snang na ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa thob par rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: When these four signs that arise from shame and abashment appear, one should know that one has attained shame and abashment.üîΩThe verse:üîΩThe chief cultivation of abashment,üîΩThe faith in the Dharma of one's own mind,

original: khrel yod bsgom pa gtso bo dang / bdag sems chos la mos pa dang // bsam pa dang ni sbyor ba dang // rtog pa med dang gcig pa las //
analyzed: khrel yod bsgom pa gtso bo dang / bdag sems chos la mos pa dang // bsam pa dang ni sbyor ba dang // rtog pa med dang gcig pa las //
translated: The intention, the application,üîΩThe non-imagination, and the sameness,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa la ji ltar bsgoms na bsgom pa dam pa dang gtso bor bsgom pa yin pa de bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa la ji ltar bsgoms na bsgom pa dam pa dang gtso bor bsgom pa yin pa de bstan te /
translated: This verse shows how shame and abashment are cultivated as the highest and chief cultivation.

original: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang dri dang / phreng ba dang byug pa la sogs pa phyi'i dngos pos mchod pa pas /
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang dri dang / phreng ba dang byug pa la sogs pa phyi'i dngos pos mchod pa pas /
translated: For example, even the Blessed Buddha is worshipped with external things such as incense, garlands, and ointments.

original: nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa sems kyis mchod pa dam pa yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa sems kyis mchod pa dam pa yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as listening, reflecting, etc. are the highest worship of the mind,

original: sems can gzhan gyis skyon btags su dogs nas gzhan la ltos te ngo tsha ba skye ba ni mchog ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis skyon btags su dogs nas gzhan la ltos te ngo tsha ba skye ba ni mchog ma yin gyi /
translated: so too, when one is ashamed of oneself, having considered that one has been criticized by others, this is not the highest.

original: bdag gis sems nyid la ltos nas bdag gis bdag khrel ba bsams te ngo tsha shes pa skyes pa na ngo tsha bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems nyid la ltos nas bdag gis bdag khrel ba bsams te ngo tsha shes pa skyes pa na ngo tsha bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag pa'o //
translated: But when one is ashamed of oneself, having considered that one has been criticized by one's own mind, then one's shame is the highest.

original: sems kyis ngo tsha bsgoms pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sems kyis ngo tsha bsgoms pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The cultivation of shame is also fivefold:

original: chos la mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / 'byor ba dang / rtog pa med pa dang bya ba gcig par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos la mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / 'byor ba dang / rtog pa med pa dang bya ba gcig par gnas pa'o //
translated: devotion to the Dharma, intention, endowment, non-imagination, and abiding in the single principle.

original: de la chos la mos pa ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la spyos shing dad pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos la mos pa ni ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la spyos shing dad pa ste /
translated: Among them, devotion to the Dharma is the faith and delight in the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma, which is well-collected by shame and conscience.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: This is also considered the highest cultivation.

original: bsam pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The intention is ninefold:

original: ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / @88a * //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / @88a * //
translated: savoring, rejoicing, delighting, being insatiable, relinquishing, delighting, being helpful,üîΩ

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa ste /üîΩde ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //üîΩ'byor ba ni /üîΩsa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtsal ba dang 'bad pa med par ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ste /üîΩde ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa ste / de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go // 'byor ba ni / sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtsal ba dang 'bad pa med par ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ste / de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: savoring, rejoicing, delighting, being insatiable, relinquishing, delighting, being helpful,

original: rtog pa med pa ni ngo tsha bar bya ba'i gnas sems can dang / ngo tsha bar byed pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / ngo tsha ba'i chos gsum char yod par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa ni ngo tsha bar bya ba'i gnas sems can dang / ngo tsha bar byed pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / ngo tsha ba'i chos gsum char yod par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: being without afflictions, and having a virtuous attitude.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: Thus, this meditation is also posited as the best meditation.

original: bya ba gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gcig gis ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i chos bsgoms na gzhan gyis kyang bsgoms pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gcig gis ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i chos bsgoms na gzhan gyis kyang bsgoms pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa yang bsgom pa'i mchog tu gzhag go //

original: brtan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtan pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ngo tsha ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu brtan pa rnam par dbye ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on conscience and the section on steadfastness that is to be explained?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams kyi gtso bo ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar ngo tsha shes pa dag ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa la zhugs pa na /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is endowed with conscience and who has undertaken cultivation

original: le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab gsum gyis nyon mi mongs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi chos gsum brtan pa dang dpa' zhes bya ba la 'byung ste /
analyzed: le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab gsum gyis nyon mi mongs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi chos gsum brtan pa dang dpa' zhes bya ba la 'byung ste /
translated: The three, laziness, distraction, and faulty wisdom, prevent the three virtues of striving, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: brtan pa de yang ngo tsha shes pa las 'byung zhing 'grub par 'gyur bas na ngo tsha ba'i rjes la brtan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: brtan pa de yang ngo tsha shes pa las 'byung zhing 'grub par 'gyur bas na ngo tsha ba'i rjes la brtan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Since stability and courage arise from a sense of shame, it is appropriate to explain the chapter on stability immediately following the chapter on shame.

original: yang na ngo tsha ba dang / khrel ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ngo tsha ba dang / khrel ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rlung gis bskyod par mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, a bodhisattva who has a sense of shame and decency cannot be moved by the winds of the afflictions, such as attachment and hostility.

original: de bas na ngo tsha ba'i rjes la brtan pa'i skabs bshad pa 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na ngo tsha ba'i rjes la brtan pa'i skabs bshad pa 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to explain the chapter on stability immediately following the chapter on shame.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa ni //
translated: The stability of the bodhisattvasüîΩis defined by its characteristics,üîΩits categories,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni dbye ba dang // mi 'gyur ba dang de las gzhan //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni dbye ba dang // mi 'gyur ba dang de las gzhan //
translated: its immutability, and its other qualities.

original: thams cad las ni khyad par zhugs //
analyzed: thams cad las ni khyad par zhugs //
translated: It is superior to all.üîΩThis verse shows the meaning of the bodhisattva's steadfastness in brief.üîΩIn this context of steadfastness, the meaning of the bodhisattva's steadfastness is shown in three aspects:

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa rab tu dbye ba'i @88b don mdor bsdus nas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa rab tu dbye ba'i @88b don mdor bsdus nas ston te /
translated: the definition of steadfastness, the classification of steadfastness, and the steadfastness of the bodhisattvas' immutability.üîΩHere, steadfastness is of three kinds:üîΩsteadfastness in the face of difficulties, steadfastness in the face of distractions, and steadfastness in the face of profundity.

original: brtan pa'i skabs 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum zhig ston te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i skabs 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum zhig ston te /
translated: Steadfastness in the face of difficulties is the bodhisattvas' patience in putting up with the hardships of austerities and so on.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of distractions is the patience of not being distracted from the Great Vehicle by the words of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / brtan pa'i dbye ba dang / brtan pa'i mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / brtan pa'i dbye ba dang / brtan pa'i mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Steadfastness in the face of profundity is the patience of not being frightened by the profound teachings of emptiness and so on.

original: de la 'jig rten pa la yang brtan pa yod /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa la yang brtan pa yod /
translated: Steadfastness in the face of difficulties is the bodhisattvas' patience in putting up with the hardships of austerities and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang brtan pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang brtan pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Steadfastness in the face of distractions is the patience of not being distracted from the Great Vehicle by the words of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of profundity is the patience of not being frightened by the profound teachings of emptiness and so on.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of difficulties is the bodhisattvas' patience in putting up with the hardships of austerities and so on.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of distractions is the patience of not being distracted from the Great Vehicle by the words of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of profundity is the patience of not being frightened by the profound teachings of emptiness and so on.üîΩ Steadfastness in the face of difficulties is the bodhisattvas' patience in putting up with the hardships of austerities and so on.

original: de dag gi brtan ba bas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dbye ba dang / mi 'gyur ba gsum gzhan las 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi brtan ba bas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dbye ba dang / mi 'gyur ba gsum gzhan las 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Steadfastness in the face of distractions is the patience of not being distracted from the Great Vehicle by the words of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: brtson 'grus ting 'dzin shes rab dang // sems pa mi g-yo brtan par 'dod //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ting 'dzin shes rab dang // sems pa mi g-yo brtan par 'dod //

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam dag ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam dag ni //
translated: The bodhisattva is pure

original: 'jigs pa med pa gsum las byung //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa gsum las byung //

original: zhes bya 'dis mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi ming gi rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa gsum 'chad do //üîΩde la brtan pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: zhes bya 'dis mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi ming gi rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa gsum 'chad do // de la brtan pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: This verse explains the three topics: the characteristics, the synonyms for the name of the characteristics, and the establishment of the characteristics.üîΩ Steadfastness is a name for three dharmas:

original: brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste chos de gsum la ming du btags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste chos de gsum la ming du btags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: vigor, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: de la dge ba'i chos la sems spro zhing mi ldog pa ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos la sems spro zhing mi ldog pa ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Vigor is the delight in and non-discouragement about wholesome dharmas.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sems rtse gcig pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sems rtse gcig pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Meditative concentration is the one-pointedness of mind in the cultivation of the four noble truths and the unshakability by the winds of discrimination.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni shes rab ste 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //üîΩbrtan pa de la ming du lta ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni shes rab ste 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan to // brtan pa de la ming du lta ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: Wisdom is the knowledge of the specific and general characteristics of dharmas. This is the teaching of the characteristics of the characteristics.üîΩ Steadfastness is also called the view of name.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called immovability.

original: brtan pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called ‚Äústeadfastness.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi ming gi rnam grangs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi ming gi rnam grangs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the synonyms of the characteristic.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi tshogs gsum la zhum pa dang / g-yo ba dag kyang gti mug gis 'jigs pa gsum la 'jigs pa med pa 'byung ste /

translated: The three kinds of fearlessness arise in the bodhisattvas from the three kinds of fear: laziness, distraction, and confusion, in regard to the three collections of effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa bstan to //

analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa gsum las 'jug pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba las /
translated: What is the engagement due to the three kinds of fearlessness?

analyzed: gong du brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos gsum gyis chos gsum la 'jigs pa med par 'jug go zhes bshad pa'i chos gsum po gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the engagement in the three kinds of fearlessness in regard to the three dharmas, through the three dharmas of effort, etc., as explained above. What are the three dharmas?

original: zhum dang g-yo dang gti mug las //
analyzed: zhum dang g-yo dang gti mug las //
translated: From laziness, distraction, and confusion,

original: bya ba rnam la 'jigs pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba rnam @89a * //
analyzed: bya ba rnam la 'jigs pa ste // zhes bya ba rnam @89a * //
translated: there is fear in regard to activity.

original: pa gsum gyis ni 'jigs pa skye ste /
analyzed: pa gsum gyis ni 'jigs pa skye ste /
translated: Fear arises in three ways.

original: zhum pas 'jigs pa skye ba dang / g-yo bas 'jigs pa skye ba dang / gti mug pas 'jigs pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhum pas 'jigs pa skye ba dang / g-yo bas 'jigs pa skye ba dang / gti mug pas 'jigs pa skye ba'o //
translated: fear of discouragement, fear of agitation, and fear of delusion.

analyzed: de la brtson 'grus med pa na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba spyod pa rlabs po che dag la bdag gis spyad par mi nus so snyam nas zhum pa la 'jigs pa skye'o //
translated: Fear of discouragement arises when one thinks, ‚ÄúI cannot practice the great waves of activity of the bodhisattva.‚Äù

analyzed: sems g-yo bar gyur na sems rtse gcig par gzhag par mi nus so snyam nas 'jigs pa skye'o // gti mug las kyang 'jigs pa skye ste /
translated: Fear of agitation arises when one thinks, ‚ÄúI cannot concentrate my mind in one place.‚ÄùüîΩFear of delusion arises when one thinks, ‚ÄúI do not know the means of attaining supreme enlightenment.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs mi shes na yang byang chub kyi spyod pa rnams la ji ltar bya gtol med pas 'jigs pa skye par 'gyur ro //

translated: Fear arises when one does not know what to do about the bodhisattva practices.üîΩTherefore, the bodhisattva should be known as steadfast

analyzed: brtan pa yin par shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
translated: The bodhisattva should be known as steadfast in the three kinds of fear.

original: de ltar zhum pa la sogs pa gsum las 'jigs pa mi skye ba na rtag pa ni lhun gyis grub pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhum pa la sogs pa gsum las 'jigs pa mi skye ba na rtag pa ni lhun gyis grub pa la bya ste /
translated: Thus, when fear does not arise from the three, such as discouragement, etc., steadfastness is to be known as the three kinds of spontaneous accomplishment.

analyzed: de la brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub pas na zhum pa'i 'jigs pa med do //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pas na g-yo ba'i 'jigs pa med do //

analyzed: shes rab lhun gyis grub pas na gti mug gi 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Because of spontaneous accomplishment of wisdom, there is no fear of delusion.

original: rtag pa ma brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag pa ma brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Steadfastness is not shaken by the three, such as hearing, etc.

original: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos gsum lhun gyis grub pa la ming du brtan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos gsum lhun gyis grub pa la ming du brtan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rtag pa ni so sor ma brtag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag pa ni so sor ma brtag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Constant‚Äù means not requiring analysis.

analyzed: so sor rtag cing 'bad mi dgos par chos gsum lhun gyis grub pa la rtag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'di yang chad du brtan pa'i mtshan nyid bshad do //

original: brtan pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtan pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To teach the divisions of stability,

analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni smon lam dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says ‚Äúnatural, aspirational,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: de la brtan pa la dbye na rigs kyis brtan pa nas byang chub dam pa la brtan pa'i bar du brgyad yod do //
translated: If stability is divided, there are eight types, from stability through lineage up to stability in supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: de la rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya bas rigs kyi brtan pa bstan te /
translated: ‚Äú Natural‚Äù teaches stability through lineage.

analyzed: la la ni brtson 'grus dang / @89b ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rigs yod pas zhum pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa med cing mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some have the potential for effort, meditative absorption, and wisdom, so they are not afraid of being discouraged and so forth, and they are stable.

original: smon lam dang zhes bya bas sems bskyed pas brtan pa bstan te /
analyzed: smon lam dang zhes bya bas sems bskyed pas brtan pa bstan te /
translated: By ‚Äúvows‚Äù he shows that the generation of the spirit of enlightenment is stable.

original: sems can log par sgrub pa yang //
analyzed: sems can log par sgrub pa yang //

original: zhes bya bas sems can gyi don la brtan pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sems can gyi don la brtan pa bstan te /

analyzed: zab cing zhes bya bas de bzhin nyid kyi don la brtan par bstan te /

analyzed: ngag gi tshul gyis 'jig rten rnams dga' ba dang mgu bar byed pa ste /

original: zhes bya ba la /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i snod du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir lus dang ngag gi sgo nas gzhan la dga' bar byed do //

analyzed: ji ltar shes na bden pa bzhi shes pa yin zhe na zhes pa'i don te /

analyzed: bden pa rnam pa gnyis las ni //

original: brtson 'grus la yang sems can gyi zhing rmo ba dang tshong bya ba la sogs pa'i las la grogs byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la yang sems can gyi zhing rmo ba dang tshong bya ba la sogs pa'i las la grogs byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su bsdu'o //
translated: Diligence in working with others in the activities of farming, commerce, and so on, in the field of sentient beings, is included in the accumulation of merit.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni ye shes kyi tshogs su bsdu'o //üîΩbsam gtan pa yang 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zag pa @102a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni ye shes kyi tshogs su bsdu'o // bsam gtan pa yang 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zag pa @102a * //
translated: Diligence in relying on spiritual friends, listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting, meditating, and so on, is included in the accumulation of wisdom.

analyzed: lnga char ye shes tshogs su'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs nyid do //

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos sam /

analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul du spyad na lnga char yang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan yang sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba gdab pa la sogs pa yang bsod nams kyi tshogs su bsdu ste /

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /

original: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsgrub ste /

translated: How is the cultivation of the antidotes different for the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por phyin ci ma log pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por phyin ci ma log pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on cultivate the four correct exertions as the antidote to the four errors.

original: gtsang bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni lus la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gtsang bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni lus la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the error of purity is the meditation on the impurity of the body,

original: glad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i rting pa'i bar du rnag dang khrag la sogs pa sgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i rting pa'i bar du rnag dang khrag la sogs pa sgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one meditates on the body from the top of the head to the soles of the feet as pus, blood, and so on.

original: bde bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar bsgom ste /
analyzed: bde bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the error of pleasure is the meditation on all feelings as suffering,

original: gang cung zad tshor ba de dag sdug bsngal lo zhes bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang cung zad tshor ba de dag sdug bsngal lo zhes bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one meditates on whatever feelings there are as suffering.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por sems mi rtag pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por sems mi rtag pa bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the error of permanence is the meditation on the impermanence of the mind,

original: sems ni skad cig skad cig par 'dod chags par 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni skad cig skad cig par 'dod chags par 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is asserted to be momentary, and because it becomes attached and hostile.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por chos thams cad la bdag med par bsgom ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por chos thams cad la bdag med par bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the error of self is the meditation on the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: because one is afflicted by attachment and so on.

original: 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i bdag gang yang med ces bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i bdag gang yang med ces bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one cultivates the idea that there is no self at all that is defiled or purified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de las khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de las khyad zhugs te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are different from those,

original: de bas na lus la sogs pa la yang /
analyzed: de bas na lus la sogs pa la yang /
translated: therefore, the body, etc.

original: chos la bdag med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because of the realization of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal pa'i rnam pa lta bur bsgom pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /üîΩde bas na de'i gnyen por lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yid la byed pa @104a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal pa'i rnam pa lta bur bsgom pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te / de bas na de'i gnyen por lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yid la byed pa @104a * //
translated: For Bodhisattvas, the aspects of impurity and suffering are themselves adverse,

original: bzhin du ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bzhin du ma yin gyi /
translated: therefore, the antidote to those is the attention to the body, feelings, etc. not as apprehended by the notional attachment to the subject and object as conceived by the foolish ordinary man,üîΩbut as the very nature of the selflessness of dharmas, like the surface of the sky.

original: thams cad kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas na gnyen po'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas na gnyen po'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
translated: Thus, it is distinguished by the aspect of the antidote.

original: ji ltar na 'jug pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jug pa zhe na /
translated: How does one engage them?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams kyis rim bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams kyis rim bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One engages the four foundations of mindfulness in order, as stated in the Abhidharmakosa: ‚ÄúOne engages the truth of suffering through the foundation of mindfulness of the body and so on.üîΩ‚Äù

original: ji ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam pas nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad zhugs she na /üîΩ'di ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam pas nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad zhugs she na / 'di ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: How does one engage them in a special way that is different from sravakas and so on?

original: lus kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa khong du chud nas lus 'di skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //üîΩtshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa khong du chud nas lus 'di skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go // tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: One engages the truth of suffering through cultivating the foundation of mindfulness of the body, because by comprehending the nature of the body one realizes that this body possesses many sufferings such as birth, aging, sickness and death and thus one engages the truth of suffering.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba bde ba myong ba ni 'dod chags bag la nyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba bde ba myong ba ni 'dod chags bag la nyal bar 'gyur /
translated: One engages the truth of origin through cultivating the foundation of mindfulness of feeling because one realizes that pleasant feeling is the latent state of attachment,

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal bar myong na ni zhe sdang bag la nyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal bar myong na ni zhe sdang bag la nyal bar 'gyur /
translated: When one experiences a painful feeling, the latent tendency of hatred is activated.

original: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong na ni gti mug bag la nyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong na ni gti mug bag la nyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one experiences a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful, the latent tendency of delusion is activated.

original: de ltar bag la nyal bar 'gyur ba de rnams kyis tshe phyi ma la len pa'i rgyu byed pas na kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bag la nyal bar 'gyur ba de rnams kyis tshe phyi ma la len pa'i rgyu byed pas na kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the latent tendencies are activated, and they become the cause for the appropriation of a new existence in the next life. Thus, one enters into the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating the close placement of mindfulness of the mind, one enters into the truth of cessation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di dag ni sems tsam du zad kyi bdag ces bya ba gang yang med kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems tsam du zad kyi bdag ces bya ba gang yang med kyi /
translated: These are merely mind, and there is no so-called self at all.

original: sems de skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: sems de skad cig ma ste /
translated: That mind is momentary,

original: rang skye zhing rang 'gag par mthong na /
analyzed: rang skye zhing rang 'gag par mthong na /
translated: and one sees that it arises and ceases by itself.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dus na bdag ces bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dus na bdag ces bya ba med de /
translated: At the time of the truth of cessation, there is no so-called self.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa mi skye bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa mi skye bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Since the fear of annihilation does not arise, one enters into the truth of cessation.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: One enters the truth of the path by cultivating the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos yin te 'khor ba'i rgyu yin par mthong /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos yin te 'khor ba'i rgyu yin par mthong /
translated: One sees that attachment and so on are afflicted dharmas and are the cause of samsara.

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i chos yin te mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yin par mthong nas dad pa la sogs pa'i chos la sgom par byed pas na lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i chos yin te mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yin par mthong nas dad pa la sogs pa'i chos la sgom par byed pas na lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: One sees that faith and so on are purifying dharmas and are the cause of nirvana. Then one cultivates the dharmas of faith and so on. Thus one enters the truth of the path.

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams 'jug par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams 'jug par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they cause oneself and others to enter.üîΩSravakas cultivate the close placement of mindfulness in order to enter the four noble truths themselves.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bdag nyid bden pa bzhi la @104b 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bdag nyid bden pa bzhi la @104b 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi
translated: Bodhisattvas cultivate the four close placements of mindfulness in order to cause both themselves and others to enter the four noble truths.

original: snyom par byed pas na 'jug pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: snyom par byed pas na 'jug pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: Thus their entry is distinctive.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is explained in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgoms na bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba bzhin du blta ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgoms na bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba bzhin du blta ste /
translated: When one cultivates the four foundations of mindfulness, one enters into the four noble truths, as it is explained in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga.

original: dbus mtha' las ji skad 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dbus mtha' las ji skad 'byung zhe na /
translated: What does the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga say?

original: lus ni gnas ngan len gyis yongs su bsgoms te /
analyzed: lus ni gnas ngan len gyis yongs su bsgoms te /
translated: The body is fully developed by the defilements.

original: de brtags na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de brtags na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: When one investigates that, one enters into the truth of suffering.

original: de la gnas ngan len ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the defilements are the characteristic of the formations,

original: gang gi phyir gnas ngan len rnams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas ngan len rnams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: all that is defiled by the suffering of the formations is suffering.

original: tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Feeling is the cause of craving.

original: de brtags pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de brtags pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: When one investigates that, one enters into the truth of the origin.

original: sems ni bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: sems ni bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The mind is the basis for the attachment to a self.

original: de brtags na 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de brtags na 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: When that is investigated, one enters into the truth of cessation,

original: bdag chad par 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chad par 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is free from the fear of the annihilation of the self.

original: chos la brtags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la kun du gti mug med pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: chos la brtags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la kun du gti mug med pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: By investigating the Dharma, one enters into the truth of the path, because one is not confused about the dharmas of affliction and purification.

original: ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: How is there objectification?

original: sems can rnams kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of objectifying the bodies, etc. of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How is there a difference in the mode of objectification?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni bdag gi lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa tsam zhig la dmigs shing sgom par byed kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni bdag gi lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa tsam zhig la dmigs shing sgom par byed kyi /
translated: The Sravakas, etc. objectify and cultivate only their own bodies, feelings, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / tshor ba la sogs pa la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / tshor ba la sogs pa la dmigs par byed do //
translated: But the Bodhisattvas objectify the bodies, feelings, etc. of themselves and all sentient beings.

original: de bas na dmigs pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: Therefore, there is a difference in the objectification.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva abide in contemplation of the body in the body?

original: de bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He abides in contemplation of his own body and the bodies of others.

original: ji ltar yid la byed pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed pas she na /
translated: How does he contemplate?

original: lus la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: By not objectifying the body, etc.

original: ji ltar yid la byed pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How does he contemplate in a distinctive way?

original: @105a * // 'di ltar nyan thos dag ni lus la mi gtsang ba'i tshul du byed /
analyzed: @105a * // 'di ltar nyan thos dag ni lus la mi gtsang ba'i tshul du byed /
translated: Thus, the disciples contemplate the body as impure,

original: tshor ba la sdug bsngal bar yid la byed /
analyzed: tshor ba la sdug bsngal bar yid la byed /
translated: contemplate feelings as suffering,

original: sems mi rtag par yid la byed /
analyzed: sems mi rtag par yid la byed /
translated: contemplate mind as impermanent,

original: chos la bdag med par yid la byed do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par yid la byed do //
translated: and contemplate dharmas as without self existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa thams cad mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yid la mi byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa thams cad mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yid la mi byed kyi /
translated: But the bodhisattva does not contemplate the body, etc. as impure, etc.

original: thams cad kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du dmigs su med pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyang nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du dmigs su med pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i phyir /
translated: He contemplates all as non-apprehensible, like the surface of the sky.

original: yid la byed pa'i khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i khyad zhugs so //
translated: The difference lies in the mental attention.

original: ji ltar thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa zhe na /
translated: How is it attained?

original: lus la sogs pa dang bral ba yang ma yin ma bral ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang bral ba yang ma yin ma bral ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is neither dissociated nor not dissociated from the body, etc.

original: ji ltar thob par khyad zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar thob par khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How does the difference lie in the attainment?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom gyi /
translated: The disciples, etc. cultivate in order to become dissociated from the body, feelings, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas do not cultivate in order to become dissociated,

original: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa yang ma yin pas thob pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so ;
analyzed: mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa yang ma yin pas thob pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so ;
translated: nor do they cultivate in order not to become dissociated. Thus the difference lies in the attainment.

original: / ji ltar 'bral ba yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar 'bral ba yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it neither dissociated nor not dissociated?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum dang mi 'bral zhing de thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pas 'bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum dang mi 'bral zhing de thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pas 'bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not dissociated because it is cultivated in order to attain the three bodies of the TathƒÅgata.

original: ji ltar mi 'bral ba yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'bral ba yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not not dissociated?

original: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pas mi 'bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pas mi 'bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that they do not separate from the body, since they meditate in order to be free of the body produced by karma and afflictions.

original: yang na sku gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir lus 'di dang yang bral bar mi byed de /
analyzed: yang na sku gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir lus 'di dang yang bral bar mi byed de /
translated: Or else, they do not separate from this body in order to attain the three bodies.

original: lus la brten nas sku gsum dgos pas na'o zhes bya ba la mi 'bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la brten nas sku gsum dgos pas na'o zhes bya ba la mi 'bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that they do not separate, since the three bodies are necessary in dependence on the body.

original: lus dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu 'di la chags par byas na so so'i skye bo bzhin du rtag tu 'khor bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu 'di la chags par byas na so so'i skye bo bzhin du rtag tu 'khor bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If they were attached to this body, which is produced by body and afflictions, and is of the nature of suffering, like a mass of foam, they would always remain in cyclic existence, like ordinary beings.

original: lus 'di ni 'di dang 'bral bar yang byed do //
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'di dang 'bral bar yang byed do //
translated: Therefore, they do separate from this body.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states,

original: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la yang rtog / lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la yang rtog ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la yang rtog / lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la yang rtog ces bya ba nas /

analyzed: lus 'di la bdag gir mi bya'i bdag lus snying po med pa 'di la snying po mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ji ltar na rjes su mthun pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva cultivates the applications of mindfulness of body, etc., and they become in accord with the six perfections, because they become the antidotes for abandoning the resistances to the six perfections, such as stinginess.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur yang dag pa ma yin zhing stong par mthong na phyi nang gi dngos po la chags pa mi skye'o //

translated: When one sees that body, sensation, etc., are not real, are empty, like an illusion, or a mirage, attachment to internal and external things does not arise.

original: chags pa ma skyes na phyi nang gi dngos po gtong bar byed pas sbyin pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: chags pa ma skyes na phyi nang gi dngos po gtong bar byed pas sbyin pa dang mthun no //

analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po gtong bar nus na tshul khrims yang dag par len pas tshul khrims dang mthun no //

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa rnams ni rdeg pa la slar mi rdeg pa dang / gshe ba la slar mi gshe bas bzod pa grub pa'i phyir bzod pa dang rjes su mthun no //

original: bzod pa la gnas pa rnams ni grang ba dang tsha ba byung yang dge ba byed pa mi gtong bas brtson 'grus grub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang rjes su mthun no //

translated: Those who abide in patience are in accord with effort, because they have achieved effort through not abandoning the performance of virtue even when cold and heat occur.

original: brtson 'grus la gnas pa rnams ni lus la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang / stong pa yin par khong du chud cing de la yang rtse gcig tu sgom par byed pas ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la gnas pa rnams ni lus la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang / stong pa yin par khong du chud cing de la yang rtse gcig tu sgom par byed pas ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Those who abide in effort are in accord with meditative concentration and wisdom, because they understand the body, etc. to be impermanent and empty and also cultivate that one-pointedly.

original: ji ltar rjes su 'jug pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'jug pa zhe na /

translated: and also by ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji ltar bsgom pa bstan pa ltar /
translated: Just as the mundane, ≈õrƒÅvaka, and pratyekabuddha establishments of mindfulness are cultivated,

translated: so too bodhisattvas cultivate them.

analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gi dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bsgom zhe na /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa'i lung 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i lung 'dod pa rnams la de dag gi lung bstan cing sgom pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach and cultivate the scriptures of the mundane establishments of mindfulness and the scriptures of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha establishments of mindfulness to those who desire them.

analyzed: lus ni sgyu ma lta bur shes te /

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po'i gzugs su med kyang rta dang glang po'i gzugs 'dra ba yang dag pa ma yin par snang ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po de yang ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa ma yin yang yod pa 'dra
