translated: Just as the form of a horse or elephant in an illusion does not exist, yet appears as the form of a horse or elephant, which is not real, in the same way, the aggregate of form does not exist as it appears, yet appears as if it did exist, which is not real.

original: ba yang dag pa ma yin par snang bas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //üîΩtshor ba rmi lam lta bur shes pas de bzhin du log pas rjes su myong ba dang zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: tshor ba ni rmi lam lta bur shes te /

translated: For example, in a dream, although there is no one who sees enemies and so on, and who experiences the fear and suffering that arises, and although there is no one who sees friends and so on, and who experiences the joy and happiness that arises, still, one experiences these things.

translated: In the same way, although there is no one who experiences the feelings of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain, still, one experiences these.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin gsal bar shes pas nam mkha' bzhin dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin gsal bar shes pas nam mkha' bzhin dang zhes bya ba la /

original: dper na nam mkha' la sprin dang du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa snang ba nam mkha'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la sprin dang du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa snang ba nam mkha'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, clouds, smoke, mist and so on appear in the sky but they are not the nature of space.

original: brnyan ma glo bur du byung ba yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: brnyan ma glo bur du byung ba yin pa de bzhin du /

original: sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos byung ba de dag kyang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos byung ba de dag kyang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin gyi /

original: brnyan ma glo bur du byung ba yin par shes so //
analyzed: brnyan ma glo bur du byung ba yin par shes so //
translated: They are adventitious images.

original: ji ltar skye bas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye bas she na /

analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ji ltar skye ba'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /

analyzed: so so'i skye bo bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ni mi skye'o //
translated: Unlike ordinary beings, they are not born through the power of karma and afflictions.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'khor los sgyur ba dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs par skyes pa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshor ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan yang /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'khor los sgyur ba dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs par skyes pa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshor ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan yang /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they intentionally take birth in existence, with a body endowed with perfect enjoyment, such as a universal monarch, ≈öakra, BrahmƒÅ, and so on, and with perfect enjoyment that is the cause for experiencing pleasant feelings.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos mi skye ste /

original: nyon mongs pas mi gos pas na skye ba'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas mi gos pas na skye ba'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
translated: It is distinguished by the mode of birth because it is not covered by afflictions.

original: ji ltar chad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chad ce na /

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ji ltar tshad kyi rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How is it distinguished by its measure?

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba yin pas yun thung du sgom zhing so so skye bo'i dus na bsgoms pas /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i dus na thob pa'i sgom pa ma yin pas /
translated: This is not the meditation that is attained at the time of the ƒÅryas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar mchog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog ce na /

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe complete ones‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar mchog gi rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog gi rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How is it distinguished by being supreme?

original: sa brgyad pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs te /

analyzed: brtsal 'bad med par @107a * //
translated: Since he cultivates them spontaneously without effort,

analyzed: lhun gyis grub par bsgoms pas na 'dres pa dang nye bar 'dres pa'i rnam pas bsgoms pas mchog gi rnam pas khyad zhugs so //

translated: When the bodhisattvas who have entered the eighth level cultivate the four close mindfulnesses, they are also cultivated by others.

analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgoms pa yang bdag gis bsgoms pa yin pas /
translated: And since those cultivated by others are also cultivated by them,

analyzed: 'dres pa dang nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to be mixed and fully mixed.

analyzed: yang na sa bdun pa las dang por sa brgyad pa thob pa'i skad cig ma la ni 'dres pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de nas sa brgyad pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa nas brtsams te /
translated: From the second moment of the eighth level

analyzed: sa dgu pa la ma zhugs kyi bar la ni nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: until the ninth level is entered, they are said to be fully mixed.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa dang shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa dang shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: ji ltar sgom pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgom pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs she na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi shes rab kyi khyad par dang snying rje'i khyad par gyis zin par bsgoms pas na phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i myang ngan las 'das kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi shes rab kyi khyad par dang snying rje'i khyad par gyis zin par bsgoms pas na phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i myang ngan las 'das kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad
translated: The bodhisattvas cultivate the four close mindfulnesses with the special wisdom and the special compassion. Therefore, even though they attain nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, the cultivation of the close mindfulnesses is inexhaustible.

original: pas na sgom pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: pas na sgom pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is distinguished by the aspect of cultivation.

original: de la shes rab kyi khyad par ni gang zag dang chos bdag med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi khyad par ni gang zag dang chos bdag med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special wisdom is due to the understanding of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: snying rje'i khyad par ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i khyad par ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji ltar thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa zhe na /
translated: How is it attained?

original: sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is attained through the ten stages and the stage of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgoms pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgoms pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob kyi /
translated: The Listeners, by cultivating the four right efforts, obtain the fruits of Stream-enterer, Once-returner, Non-returner, and Arhat.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni sa bcu thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni sa bcu thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis thob ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvas, by cultivating the four right efforts, obtain the ten levels and the buddha level.

original: de bas na thob pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: de bas na thob pa'i rnam pas khyad zhugs so //
translated: Thus they are distinguished by their attainment.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five verses on the analysis of the bases of success.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the foundations of mindfulness and the section on the bases of success?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgom pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas thob par bya ba'i bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa yod pas sgrib pa de bsal bar @107b bya ba'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas thob par bya ba'i bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa yod pas sgrib pa de bsal bar @107b bya ba'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom ste /
translated: The four right efforts are cultivated as the antidote to the obscurations that obstruct the attainment of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: de bas na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to explain the chapter on the right efforts immediately after the chapter on the foundations of mindfulness.

original: brtan pa'i yang dag spong ba ni //
analyzed: brtan pa'i yang dag spong ba ni //
translated: The steadfast's right efforts

original: lus can kun dang mnyam pa min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus can kun dang mnyam pa min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are not shared in common with others.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The right efforts are fourfold:üîΩnon-arising of non-virtuous dharmas that have not arisen,üîΩabandonment of non-virtuous dharmas that have arisen,üîΩarising of virtuous dharmas that have not arisen,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa 'phel bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa 'phel bar bya ba'o //
translated: and increase of virtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: de la bstan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi don du bsgoms pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yang dag par spong ba bzhi bzhi bsgom pa las kyang khyad zhugs pas
analyzed: de la bstan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi don du bsgoms pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yang dag par spong ba bzhi bzhi bsgom pa las kyang khyad zhugs pas
translated: The bodhisattvas' meditation on the four correct endeavors is superior to the listeners' and solitary realizers' meditation on the four correct endeavors because they meditate for the sake of themselves and all sentient beings.

original: na / lus can kun dang mnyam pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag nyes pa'i //
analyzed: na / lus can kun dang mnyam pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag nyes pa'i //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is not the same as that of all embodied beings.üîΩThe antidote to the faults of the close mindfulnesses

original: gnyen po shin du sgom par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyen po shin du sgom par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: is the thorough training in them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi sgom pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la nyes pa dang skyon yod pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir gnyen po bsgom ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi sgom pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la nyes pa dang skyon yod pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir gnyen po bsgom ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas' meditation on the four correct endeavors is the meditation on the antidotes in order to eliminate the faults and defects in the meditation on the four close mindfulnesses.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i nyes pa ni gong du theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab rten du bshad pa la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i nyes pa ni gong du theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab rten du bshad pa la /
translated: The faults of the close mindfulnesses were explained above in the section on the wisdom of listening, reflecting and meditating that is the support for the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos mi nyan mi sems mi sgom pa ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos mi nyan mi sems mi sgom pa ni nyes pa'o //
translated: Not listening to, not reflecting on, and not cultivating the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma is a fault.

original: de bzhin du thob pa'i rnam pa las bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa ma thob na sgrib pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thob pa'i rnam pa las bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa ma thob na sgrib pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: tshigs bcad 'dis ni yang dag par spong ba'i don gyi phyir bshad pa'am /
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'dis ni yang dag par spong ba'i don gyi phyir bshad pa'am /
translated: This verse explains the meaning of right abandonment,

original: mdor bsdus te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te bshad pa'o //

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji snyed du bshad pa de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji snyed du bshad pa de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As many as are the explanations of the foundations of mindfulness, etc.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhir bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji snyed pa yod pa de dag spang ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhir bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji snyed pa yod pa de dag spang ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo //
translated: As many as are the fourteen aspects explained as based on the foundations of mindfulness, etc., for the abandonment of those that exist as counteragents to them, one cultivates the right abandonments.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi mdor bstan nas de yang dag pa'i spong ba phye ste bstan na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having briefly taught the four right abandonments, it is said that they are explained by analyzing right abandonment.

analyzed: 'khor ba la ni longs spyod dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In samsara, there is enjoyment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @108a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @108a * //
translated: In samsara, the bodhisattva,

original: sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lus blangs nas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'i dus na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lus blangs nas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'i dus na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir
translated: for the sake of sentient beings, having taken up a body as Indra, Brahma, and so on, when experiencing the perfection of enjoyment, in order not to be stained by afflictions such as attachment and not to come under the power of afflictions,

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // sgrib pa dag ni gtong ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he cultivates the four right efforts. This is the meaning.üîΩAnd for the relinquishment of obscurations,

original: gtong ba ni spong ba la bya ste /
analyzed: gtong ba ni spong ba la bya ste /
translated: Relinquishment refers to abandonment.

original: sgrib pa lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to abandon the five obscurations, he cultivates the four right efforts. This is the meaning.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: The five obscurations are attachment to sense objects, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: yid la byed pa gtong ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gtong ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And relinquishing mental attention.

original: 'dir yang gtong ba'i sgras spong ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang gtong ba'i sgras spong ba la bya ste /
translated: Here also, the term ‚Äúrelinquishing‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúabandoning.‚Äù

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don yid la mi byed kyi /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: but in order to abandon the mental attention of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should cultivate the four right efforts. This is the meaning.

original: sa nyid la ni 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa nyid la ni 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And entering into the stages.

original: mos pas sbyong ba'i sa nas sa dang po la 'jug par bya ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos spong bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pas sbyong ba'i sa nas sa dang po la 'jug par bya ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos spong bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the phenomena that would obstruct entering from the stage of action in faith into the first stage,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should cultivate the four right efforts. This is the meaning.

original: mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni sa bdun pa ste /

translated: The meaning of the above is that one cultivates the correct abandonings in order to attain the seventh ground and to abide on the seventh ground, in order to abandon the faults that are obstacles to that.

original: lung bstan pa yang thob pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lung bstan pa yang thob pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also to attain the prediction.

original: lung bstan pa ni sa brgyad pa ste /üîΩsa brgyad pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung bstan pa ni sa brgyad pa ste / sa brgyad pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The prediction is the eighth ground.

original: sa brgyad pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that one cultivates the correct abandonings in order to attain the eighth ground, in order to abandon the faults that are obstacles to attaining the eighth ground.

original: sems can yongs su smin byed dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And to ripen sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin byed pa ni sa dgu pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed pa ni sa dgu pa ste /

analyzed: sa dgu pa'i tshe so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas sems can la chos bstan pa'i sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sa dgu pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod @108b pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom mo //
translated: In order to eliminate the obscurations that interrupt the attainment of the ninth stage, they cultivate the four correct exertions.üîΩThe consecration of the wise

original: blo ldan rnams kyi dbang bskur dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi dbang bskur dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The consecration of the wiseüîΩ

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba thob pa la ni sa bcu pa rnams te /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have attained the consecration of the regent are those on the tenth stage.

analyzed: sa bcu thob par bya ba la sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to eliminate the obscurations that interrupt the attainment of the tenth stage, they cultivate the four correct exertions.üîΩIn order to purify the fields

analyzed: zhing rnams rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to purify the fields.üîΩüîΩ

original: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa nyid la sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa gzhi shel la sogs pa'i kha dog lta bur yongs su sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa nyid la sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa gzhi shel la sogs pa'i kha dog lta bur yongs su sbyong bar byed de /
translated: On the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages, they purify the buddha fields, the ground of which is like crystal and so on.

original: sa gsum la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa gsum la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: On the three stages, one cultivates the four right efforts in order to eliminate the obscurations that are the counteragents to the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: mthar ni thug par 'gro ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthar ni thug par 'gro ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ultimate is the stage that goes to the end.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: The stage that goes to the ultimate end is the eleventh stage, the stage of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One cultivates the four right efforts in order to eliminate the obscurations that are the counteragents to the attainment of buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas' cultivation

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the antidote to the counteragents.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom pa ni 'khor ba na longs spyod pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom pa ni 'khor ba na longs spyod pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' cultivation of the four right efforts is from the enjoyment of cyclic existence,

analyzed: mthar thug pa'i 'gro ba dag la sgrib pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i phyir bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the cultivation of the four right efforts.

original: dad la brten nas rnal 'byor bsgom //
analyzed: dad la brten nas rnal 'byor bsgom //
translated: 10. The cultivation of yoga is based on faith;

original: mtshan ma dang ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang ni bcas pa'o //
translated: it is accompanied by the signs.

original: yang dag spong ba thams cad la //
analyzed: yang dag spong ba thams cad la //
translated: In all the right efforts,

original: gnyen po gang du bshad pa yin //
analyzed: gnyen po gang du bshad pa yin //
translated: it is explained as the antidote.

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi bsgom pa bstan te /

analyzed: de la dad pa la brten cing gnas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of yoga is based on and supported by faith. The cultivation of serenity and insight is called the cultivation of yoga.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yang zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgoms te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yang zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgoms te /
translated: The cultivation of serenity and insight is accompanied by the signs of serenity, the signs of exaltation, and the signs of equanimity.

original: de ltar bsgom pa ni gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba rab tu dbye ba la bar du gcod pa thams @109a * //üîΩcad kyi gnyen po yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa ni gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba rab tu dbye ba la bar du gcod pa thams @109a * // cad kyi gnyen po yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the four right efforts is explained as the antidote to all the obstacles to the analysis of the right efforts.

original: 'dis ni dad pa bskyed pa dang // rtsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdad la brten nas rnal 'byor bsgom //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdo sde las dad pa bskyed pa dang / rtsol ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems rab tu 'dzin cing /üîΩyang dag par 'jog ces bya ba'i tshig lnga'i don 'chad de de la dad pa bskyed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dad pa bskyed pa dang // rtsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dad la brten nas rnal 'byor bsgom // zhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdo sde las dad pa bskyed pa dang / rtsol ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems rab tu 'dzin cing / yang dag par 'jog ces bya ba'i tshig lnga'i don 'chad de de la dad pa bskyed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gzhi'o //
translated: This verse explains the meaning of the five terms: arousing faith, exerting effort, being energetic, holding the mind, and correctly settling.üîΩOne verse on the analysis of the bases of psychic powerüîΩThe bases of psychic power are to be understood as fourfold: faith, energy, mind, and examination.

original: rtsol ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The bases of psychic power are to be understood as fourfold: the basis of psychic power consisting of the concentration and exertion of will, the basis of psychic power consisting of the concentration and exertion of energy, the basis of psychic power consisting of the concentration and exertion of mind, and the basis of psychic power consisting of the concentration and exertion of investigation.

original: dad pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dad pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: On the basis of faith, one cultivates the yoga of serenity and insight, etc.

original: 'di ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar 'dod pa'i mos pa la brten nas /üîΩrnal 'byor pas nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar 'dod pa'i mos pa la brten nas / rnal 'byor pas nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, on the basis of the aspiration to prevent the arising of non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, to abandon those that have arisen, to produce virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, to increase those that have arisen,üîΩthe yogi cultivates the yoga of serenity and insight in order to abandon the afflictions.

original: dang por zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa ni rtsol ba zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbsgom pa de dang zhi gnas dang gzengs bstod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dang por zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa ni rtsol ba zhes bya ba'o // bsgom pa de dang zhi gnas dang gzengs bstod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This is called ‚Äúexertion.‚ÄùüîΩIn the cultivation of that yoga, the cultivation of serenity and insight, etc.,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa 'ba' zhig bsgom par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa 'ba' zhig bsgom par ma zad kyi /
translated: it is not only the cultivation of the yoga of serenity and insight that is cultivated.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyu zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / gtang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgoms te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyu zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / gtang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgoms te /
translated: He cultivates the sign of serenity, the sign of stimulation, and the sign of equanimity, which are the causes of serenity and insight.

original: de ltar bsgom pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Cultivation in this way is called ‚Äúwith signs.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one cultivate?

original: gang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The remedy for the secondary defilements of slackness and excitedness, etc.

original: ji ltar na zhi gnas dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa dag 'byung zhing bar du gcod de //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhi gnas dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa dag 'byung zhing bar du gcod de //
translated: How is it that cultivation with the signs of serenity, stimulation, and equanimity is interrupted by the secondary defilements of slackness and excitedness?

original: nam gnyid du rmugs pa la sogs pas sems non na zhum par 'gyur ba de na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan nam /
analyzed: nam gnyid du rmugs pa la sogs pas sems non na zhum par 'gyur ba de na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan nam /
translated: When the mind is oppressed by sleepiness, etc., there is slackness.üîΩWhen there is a tendency to distraction, there is excitedness.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dag yid la byed pa'i gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems spro ba bskyed par bya'o //üîΩnam 'dod @109b pa'i yon tan dag la sems 'phros nas g-yeng bar 'gyur na /üîΩ'khor ba'i skyon skye rga na 'chi ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dag yid la byed pa'i gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems spro ba bskyed par bya'o // nam 'dod @109b pa'i yon tan dag la sems 'phros nas g-yeng bar 'gyur na / 'khor ba'i skyon skye rga na 'chi ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas /
translated: When the mind is slack, one should uplift it by bringing to mind the signs of serenity and insight, and by bringing to mind the results of the meditative absorptions.

original: sems gzhil bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems gzhil bar bya ste /
translated: When the mind is excited, one should calm it by bringing to mind the faults of cyclic existence, such as birth, aging, sickness, and death.üîΩIn this way, one should practice the meditative development of the wings of enlightenment.

original: de ltar byed pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the practice of vigor.

original: ji ltar tsom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tsom zhe na /
translated: How does one practice it?

original: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa ste zhes bya ba la zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma la brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang ji ltar brtson zhe na //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa ste zhes bya ba la zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma la brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang ji ltar brtson zhe na //
translated: One practices it by means of the close placement of mindfulness, the correct determination of the causal process, the bases of supernormal power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the branches of the path.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dag /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dag /
translated: One practices it by means of the close placement of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par 'jog pa'i tshul du brtson 'grus rtsom ste ;
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog pa'i tshul du brtson 'grus rtsom ste ;
translated: One practices it by means of the correct determination of the causal process.

original: / de la zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis spangs nas /
analyzed: / de la zhum pa dang rgod pa gnyis spangs nas /
translated: In this regard, having abandoned both slackness and excitedness,

original: sems mnyam pa nyid thob pas ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid thob pas ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he attains the evenness of mind. Therefore, it is called the holding of the mind in balance.

original: de'i 'og tu sems mi bskyod pa btang snyoms nyid du 'jog pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems mi bskyod pa btang snyoms nyid du 'jog pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, he places the mind in a state of equanimity, which is unshakable. This is called the correct placement of the mind.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor du bsgom pa 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor du bsgom pa 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: These are the cultivations of yoga as they have been explained.

original: dad pa bskyed pa dang / rtsol ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i tshul du bsgom pa de dag ni gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba rab tu dbye ba bshad pa la /
analyzed: dad pa bskyed pa dang / rtsol ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i tshul du bsgom pa de dag ni gong du yang dag pa'i spong ba rab tu dbye ba bshad pa la /
translated: The cultivations of faith, vigor, etc., in the five modes are called the cultivations of the applications of mindfulness.

original: bar du gcod pa'i gnyen po yin par bshad do //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i gnyen po yin par bshad do //
translated: They are explained as the antidotes to the obstructions.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are five verses on the analysis of the bases of psychic power.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs bshad pa 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs bshad pa 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the correct abandonings and the section on the bases of psychic power that is about to be presented?

original: de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous actions that have not yet arisen, to abandon those that have arisen, to give rise to virtuous actions that have not yet arisen, and to increase those that have arisen,üîΩ

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sdig pa'i chos la sems mi 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sdig pa'i chos la sems mi 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
translated: Thus, one attains concentration in which the mind does not engage in sinful dharmas in order to prevent the arising of sinful, non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, to abandon those that have arisen, to give rise to virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, and to increase those that have arisen.üîΩOne begins striving.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i spong ba'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i spong ba'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the bases of supernatural powers are explained in the section after the correct abandonings.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Supernatural power is flying through the sky and so on.

original: de thob par byed pa'i rgyu mos pa la sogs pa bzhi pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhes bya ste /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i rgyu mos pa la sogs pa bzhi pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhes bya ste /
translated: The four causes that bring it about are called the four bases of supernatural power.

original: rkang pa ni rgyu la bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ni rgyu la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúbase‚Äù is used for the cause.

original: yang na gang zag gang la rkang pa yod pa des gang du bgrod du bya ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa de bzhin du gang la mos pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yod pa de 'jig rten las @110a * //
analyzed: yang na gang zag gang la rkang pa yod pa des gang du bgrod du bya ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa de bzhin du gang la mos pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yod pa de 'jig rten las @110a * //
translated: Or, just as a person who has feet goes to the place he wants to go, so one who has the four qualities of aspiration, etc. attains the supramundane dharmas.

original: 'das pa'i chos thob par 'gyur bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos thob par 'gyur bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus they are called the bases of psychic power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par dbye ba yang tshigs su bcad pa lngas ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par dbye ba yang tshigs su bcad pa lngas ston to //
translated: The analysis of the bases of psychic power is presented in five verses.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams ni //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams ni //
translated: The four bases of psychic power

original: brtan pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: are the supreme characteristics of the steadfast.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi pas brten pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / spyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mtshan nyid mchog yin te //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi pas brten pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / spyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mtshan nyid mchog yin te //
translated: The four bases of psychic power of the steadfast bodhisattvas, which are aspiration, striving, mind, and investigation, are the supreme characteristics of the steadfast bodhisattvas, because they are the cause of the bodhisattvas‚Äô psychic power.

original: de dag pas khyad zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag pas khyad zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is superior to those.

original: ji ltar mchog yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog yin zhe na /
translated: How is it superior?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / bdag dang gzhan dag rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag dang gzhan dag rnams kyi yang //
translated: For oneself and others,

original: don rnams thams cad 'grub 'gyur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don rnams thams cad 'grub 'gyur ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: all aims are accomplished.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ni bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ni bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom gyi /
translated: The cultivation of the bases of supernatural power by the disciples and hermit buddhas is for the sake of accomplishing one's own aim.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don thams cad 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bsgom ste /
translated: But the cultivation of the bases of supernatural power by the bodhisattvas is for the sake of accomplishing all aims of both oneself and others.

original: de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa las 'phags so //
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa las 'phags so //
translated: Therefore, it is superior to that of the disciples and so on.

original: don thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi don dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don te //
analyzed: don thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi don dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don te //
translated: All aims are mundane and supramundane aims.

original: 'jig rten gyi don ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'byor ba 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'byor ba 'thob pa'o //
translated: The mundane aim is to attain the prosperity of Indra, Brahma, and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ni byang chub rnam pa gsum 'thob pa'o //üîΩrten dang rab tu dbye ba dang // thabs dang mngon par bsgrub pa yis //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ni byang chub rnam pa gsum 'thob pa'o // rten dang rab tu dbye ba dang // thabs dang mngon par bsgrub pa yis //
translated: The supramundane meaning is the attainment of the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: blo ldan rdzu 'phrul rkang pa rnams //
analyzed: blo ldan rdzu 'phrul rkang pa rnams //
translated: The wise establish the bases of psychic power

original: thams cad rnam par gzhag par 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par gzhag par 'dod //
translated: in all respects as having four aspects:üîΩfoundation, analysis,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: means, and realization.

original: blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhi ltar rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhi ltar rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: The wise bodhisattvas establish all the bases of psychic power, which are will, energy, mind, and examination, in all respects as having four aspects,

original: rnam pa bzhi lta bur 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi lta bur 'dod de /
translated: and they are considered to have four aspects.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni rten dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / thabs dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni rten dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / thabs dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The four aspects are foundation, analysis, means, and realization.

original: tshigs su cad pa'i 'dis ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don mdor bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su cad pa'i 'dis ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don mdor bstan te /
translated: This verse in summary teaches the meaning of the establishment of the bases of psychic power.

analyzed: tshigs su bad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni de'i don zhib tu bshad do //
translated: The rest of the verses explain that meaning in detail.

analyzed: bsam gtan pha rol phyin pa la gnas //
translated: And abide in the perfection of meditation.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: He abides in the perfection of meditative stabilization.üîΩHere,

original: @110b 'dis ni rten bstan te /
analyzed: @110b 'dis ni rten bstan te /
translated: this shows the basis.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'i gnas dang / rten ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'i gnas dang / rten ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa yin te /
translated: The basis and support of the four bases of supernormal powers are the first, second, third, and fourth meditative stabilizations of the form realm.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bsam gtan pha rol phyin la gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan pha rol phyin la gnas //
translated: he abides in the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: zhes bya'o // de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra also says,

analyzed: gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu //
translated: Moreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,

original: byang chub sems pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas‚Äô four bases of supernormal power are inexhaustible.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They areüîΩinterest, effort, intention, and analysis.

original: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa dang // de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten dang gnas ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang tshad med pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa dang // de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten dang gnas ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang tshad med pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: The root and basis of those is the four immeasurables: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de tshad med pa bzhi po de dag la bsnyen cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshad med pa bzhi po de dag la bsnyen cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating and frequently practicing those four immeasurables, he attains mental flexibility.

original: de sems las su rung ba thob pas bsam gtan dang po la sems mnyam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de sems las su rung ba thob pas bsam gtan dang po la sems mnyam par gzhag go //
translated: Having attained mental flexibility, he places his mind in equipoise in the first concentration.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / de bzhin bzhi pa la sogs pa la yang mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / de bzhin bzhi pa la sogs pa la yang mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: Similarly, he places his mind in equipoise in the second, third, and fourth concentrations, and so on.

original: de bsam gtan thob pas lus dang sems yang 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de bsam gtan thob pas lus dang sems yang 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: Having attained the concentrations, he attains lightness of body and mind.

original: de lus dang sems yang ba ldan pas mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa la rab tu bsgrub po zhes bya ba bya la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lus dang sems yang ba ldan pas mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa la rab tu bsgrub po zhes bya ba bya la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Endowed with lightness of body and mind, he accomplishes the entry into the superknowledges.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourfold division is as follows:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa phye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa phye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: When the bases of supernatural powers are classified, there are four.

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: They are the concentration of aspiration, the concentration of effort, the concentration of mind, and the concentration of investigation.

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par mos shing yid ches pa la brten nas spro zhing gus pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par mos shing yid ches pa la brten nas spro zhing gus pa bskyed de /
translated: On the basis of conviction and trust in the emptiness and selflessness of all phenomena, one generates enthusiasm and respect.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: From the practice of diligence, the mind becomes one-pointed, and this is called the concentration of conviction.

original: yang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar bya bar 'dod pa dang mos pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: yang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar bya bar 'dod pa dang mos pa bskyed nas /
translated: Alternatively, in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, to eliminate those that have arisen, to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, and to increase those that have arisen, one generates conviction and enthusiasm.

original: gus par brtson 'grus brtsams pa las /
analyzed: gus par brtson 'grus brtsams pa las /
translated: From the practice of diligence with respect,

original: sems rtse gcig par gyur ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //üîΩyang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma @111a * //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig par gyur ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o // yang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma @111a * //
translated: the mind becomes one-pointed, and this is called the concentration of conviction.

original: skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, to eliminate those that have arisen, to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, and to increase those that have arisen,

original: brtson 'grus su rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rtag tu brtsams pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus su rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rtag tu brtsams pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration of energy is the one-pointedness of mind that comes from uninterrupted and constant application of energy.

original: sems ni zhi gnas la bya ste /
analyzed: sems ni zhi gnas la bya ste /
translated: The concentration of mind is the one-pointedness of mind that comes from the pacification of mind.

original: tshe snga ma la zhi gnas bsgoms pa'i bag chags sems la brlan pa las bag chags de la brten nas /
analyzed: tshe snga ma la zhi gnas bsgoms pa'i bag chags sems la brlan pa las bag chags de la brten nas /
translated: The latent impressions of the cultivation of serenity in a previous life moisten the mind.

original: tshe 'dir 'bad pa chen po med par sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir 'bad pa chen po med par sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: On the basis of those latent impressions, the one-pointedness of mind arises in this life without great effort. This is called the concentration of mind.

original: dpyod pa ni lhag mthong la bya ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni lhag mthong la bya ste /
translated: The concentration of analysis is the one-pointedness of mind that comes from the analysis of insight.

original: gang gzhan dag gis chos bstan pa rnams la shes rab kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gis chos bstan pa rnams la shes rab kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: When one is free from doubt through the analysis of the characteristics of wisdom in the teachings of others,

original: the tshom dang bral nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang bral nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: one-pointedness of mind arises. This is called the concentration of analysis.

original: thabs dang mngon par bsgrub pa la rnam pa yang ni drug ces bya'o zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgrub pa'i thabs ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: thabs dang mngon par bsgrub pa la rnam pa yang ni drug ces bya'o zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgrub pa'i thabs ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The means for accomplishing the four bases of supernatural powers is fourfold.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa ste 'bras bu ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa ste 'bras bu ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: The accomplishment, i.e., the result, is sixfold.

original: dang po spro ba byed pa ste /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po spro ba byed pa ste / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is the means of arousing zeal.

original: thabs dang po ni spro ba byed pa'i thabs te spro ba byed pa'i thabs ni brtson 'grus la bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang po ni spro ba byed pa'i thabs te spro ba byed pa'i thabs ni brtson 'grus la bya'o //
translated: The first means is the means of arousing zeal. The means of arousing zeal is vigor.

original: gnyis pa phan 'dogs bdag nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: gnyis pa phan 'dogs bdag nyid do // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The second is the means of benefitting.

original: / thabs gnyis pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: / thabs gnyis pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid de //
translated: The second means is the means of benefitting.

original: lus dang sems pa dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems pa dag par byed pa'o //
translated: It purifies body and mind.

original: gsum pa 'jog par byed pa ste /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa 'jog par byed pa ste / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third is the means of fixing.

original: thabs gsum pa ni 'jog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thabs gsum pa ni 'jog par byed pa ste /
translated: The third means is the means of fixing.

original: ting nge 'dzin la rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //üîΩbzhi pa nyid ni gnyen po'o//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o // bzhi pa nyid ni gnyen po'o//
translated: It is the one-pointed abiding in samadhi.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is the means of antidotes.

original: thabs bzhi pa ni gnyen po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thabs bzhi pa ni gnyen po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The fourth method is the antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa brgyad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa brgyad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eight formative forces of abandonment are mentioned in the verse.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa brgyad yod do //
translated: There are eight formative forces of abandonment that are antidotes which abandon the adverse side that obstructs the bases of supernatural powers.

original: mos pa dang / dad pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: mos pa dang / dad pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: They are: aspiration, faith, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, introspection, intention, and equanimity.

original: de la mos pa dang / rtsol ba dang dad pa gsum la ni spro ba'i thabs zhes @111b bya'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa dang / rtsol ba dang dad pa gsum la ni spro ba'i thabs zhes @111b bya'o //
translated: Among them, aspiration, effort, and faith are called the method of enthusiasm.

original: de ci'i phyir de gsum la spro ba'i thabs zhes bya ba zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir dad par gyur na mos dang rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de gsum la spro ba'i thabs zhes bya ba zhe na / de'i phyir dad par gyur na mos dang rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why are those three called the method of enthusiasm?

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: Because of aspiration and effort when there is faith.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par byar rung bar yid ches //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par byar rung bar yid ches //
translated: In this regard, faith is the conviction that nirvana is to be attained.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par byar rung bar yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par byar rung bar yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the conviction that the noble path is to be practiced.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i dad pa yod na /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i dad pa yod na /
translated: When one has the faith of conviction in this way,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bsgrub par bya ba la 'dod pa skye ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bsgrub par bya ba la 'dod pa skye ste /
translated: one generates the desire to attain nirvana and to practice the path.

original: de bas na mos pa'i rgyu ni dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mos pa'i rgyu ni dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, faith is the cause of aspiration.

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: Hence, in other scriptures it is said:

original: dad pa ni mos pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dad pa ni mos pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can no zhes bshad do //
translated: Faith is the support of aspiration and has the function of giving.

original: de ltar smos pa ni 'gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: de ltar smos pa ni 'gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: When one has faith in this way, one generates effort in order to attain nirvana and to cultivate the path.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus kyi rgyun ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus kyi rgyun ni mos pa'o //
translated: Thus, aspiration is the continuity of effort.

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in other scriptures it is said:

original: mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las can no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las can no zhes bshad do //
translated: Aspiration is the support of effort and has the function of giving.

original: de bas na de gsum ni spro ba'i thabs su gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na de gsum ni spro ba'i thabs su gzhag go //
translated: Thus, these three are the means of instigation.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni phan 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni phan 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pliancy is the means of assistance.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
translated: Pliancy is a fitness of body and mind.

original: de ni phan 'dogs pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de ni phan 'dogs pa'i thabs so //
translated: It is the means of assistance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus las su rung bas ni lus la phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: lus las su rung bas ni lus la phan 'dogs te /
translated: Fitness of body assists the body,

original: lus zo mdog bde ba dang / yang na skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus zo mdog bde ba dang / yang na skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the body comfortable and light.

original: sems las su rung ba ni sems la phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba ni sems la phan 'dogs te /
translated: Fitness of mind assists the mind,

original: sems ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la myur du 'jug pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pas mi non par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la myur du 'jug pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pas mi non par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the mind quickly enter the object of concentration and not be overcome by drowsiness, sloth, etc.

original: dran pa dang shes pa bzhin ni 'jog par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes pa bzhin ni 'jog par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like mindfulness and vigilance, it is the means of establishment.

original: dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin la bya //
analyzed: dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin la bya //
translated: Mindfulness is the establishment of concentration.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab la bya ste /
translated: Vigilance is the establishment of wisdom.

original: de gnyis ni 'jog par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'jog par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: These two are called the means of establishment.

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis la 'jog par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis la 'jog par byed pa'i thabs zhes bya zhe na //
translated: Why are these two called the means of establishing?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir // dang pos ni sems dmigs pa la mi g-yeng ba dang / gnyis pa ni g-yeng ba rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir // dang pos ni sems dmigs pa la mi g-yeng ba dang / gnyis pa ni g-yeng ba rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: The first is because the mind is not distracted from the meditative object, and the second is because distraction is well known.

original: dang po ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin dran pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin dran pa la bya ste /
translated: The first is mindfulness, which has the nature of calm abiding.

original: des ni sems ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las sems gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'phros shing g-yeng ba las slar bsdus nas rtse gcig tu 'jog pas na 'jog pa'i thabs @112a * //
analyzed: des ni sems ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las sems gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'phros shing g-yeng ba las slar bsdus nas rtse gcig tu 'jog pas na 'jog pa'i thabs @112a * //
translated: Since it establishes the mind in one-pointed concentration by withdrawing the mind from the distraction of objects such as form, it is called the means of establishing.

original: zhes bya'o // gnyis pa ni shes bzhin shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gnyis pa ni shes bzhin shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The second is introspection, which has the nature of wisdom.

original: des sems yul la g-yeng bar gyur na g-yeng bar shes nas myur ba myur bar ldon par byed pas na 'jog par byed pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: des sems yul la g-yeng bar gyur na g-yeng bar shes nas myur ba myur bar ldon par byed pas na 'jog par byed pa'i thabs so //
translated: Since it quickly returns the mind to its meditative object when it is distracted by objects, it is the means of establishing.

original: sems pa dang btang snyoms ni gnyen po'i thabs te zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: sems pa dang btang snyoms ni gnyen po'i thabs te zhes bya ba la //
translated: Mindfulness and equanimity are the means of antidotes.

original: sems pa dang btang snyoms gnyis la ni gnyen po'i thabs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa dang btang snyoms gnyis la ni gnyen po'i thabs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Intention and equanimity are called the means of antidotes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems pas ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi gnyen po byed /
analyzed: sems pas ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi gnyen po byed /
translated: Intention acts as the antidote to the two secondary afflictions of depression and agitation.

original: btang snyoms kyis ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po byed do //
translated: Equanimity acts as the antidote to the afflictions of attachment, aversion and so on.

original: sems zhum par gyur ba'i dus na ni sems pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa yid la byas nas sems gzengs bstod de /üîΩzhum pa sel bar byed do //üîΩnam sems rgod par gyur ba na 'khor ba'i skyon la sogs pa yid la byas nas sems zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhum par gyur ba'i dus na ni sems pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa yid la byas nas sems gzengs bstod de / zhum pa sel bar byed do // nam sems rgod par gyur ba na 'khor ba'i skyon la sogs pa yid la byas nas sems zhi bar bya ste /
translated: When the mind is depressed, intention elevates the mind by contemplating the qualities of the tathagatas and so on and dispels depression.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: When the mind is agitated, it pacifies the mind by contemplating the faults of samsara and so on and engages it in virtue.

original: sems pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Therefore intention is the antidote to the two secondary afflictions.üîΩEquanimity is the antidote to the afflictions of attachment and so on.

original: btang snyoms kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa'i chos skye ba dang mi mthun pa yin pas /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa'i chos skye ba dang mi mthun pa yin pas /
translated: Equanimity is incompatible with the generation of the dharmas of the mental afflictions.

original: ji srid du btang snyoms su gnas pa de srid du nyon mongs pa rnams sems la cung zad kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlta ba dang ni lung nod 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi 'bras bu drug mngon par sgrub par drug gang yin pa ste ton /
analyzed: ji srid du btang snyoms su gnas pa de srid du nyon mongs pa rnams sems la cung zad kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // lta ba dang ni lung nod 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi 'bras bu drug mngon par sgrub par drug gang yin pa ste ton /
translated: As long as one remains in equanimity, the mental afflictions do not arise in the mind in the least.üîΩThe four bases of supernatural powers accomplish six results.

original: mngon par sgrub pa drug gi lta ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / lung nod pa mngon par sgrub pa dag /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa drug gi lta ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / lung nod pa mngon par sgrub pa dag /
translated: The six results are the accomplishment of view, the accomplishment of scriptural knowledge,

original: gnas pas rnam par rtsom pa mngon par sgrub pa dan /
analyzed: gnas pas rnam par rtsom pa mngon par sgrub pa dan /
translated: the accomplishment of the creation of abodes,

original: smon pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang byed pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / chos thob pa mngon par sgrub pa'o //üîΩde la blta ba ni spyan rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smon pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang byed pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / chos thob pa mngon par sgrub pa'o // de la blta ba ni spyan rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: the accomplishment of aspiration, the accomplishment of mastery, and the accomplishment of the attainment of dharmas.üîΩAmong them, view is the five eyes.

original: spyan lnga ba lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyan lnga ba lta ba zhes bya ste /

original: spyan lnga ni sha'i skyon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyan lnga ni sha'i skyon la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five eyes are the fleshly eye, and so on.

original: de la sha'i spyan ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pa'i mthus mig 'di lta bu rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sha'i spyan ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pa'i mthus mig 'di lta bu rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: The fleshly eye is the eye that is the ripened result of the bodhisattvas' cultivation of the bases of miraculous powers.

original: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yod pa'i gzugs che phra ci yod thams cad mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yod pa'i gzugs che phra ci yod thams cad mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the eye by which they see all the gross and subtle forms that exist in the great trichiliocosm.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan ni bsam gtan dang po gnyis pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa las grub pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan ni bsam gtan dang po gnyis pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa las grub pa ste /
translated: The eye of preternatural knowledge is achieved through the cultivation of the first and second absorptions and so on.

original: sha'i spyan bas khyad zhugs @112b par gyur bas na gang gi phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi gzugs che phra thams cad mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sha'i spyan bas khyad zhugs @112b par gyur bas na gang gi phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi gzugs che phra thams cad mthong ba'o //
translated: It is superior to the fleshly eye and so sees all the gross and subtle forms of the ten directions and three times.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The eye of noble wisdom is nonconceptual gnosis.

original: chos kyi spyan ni mdo'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos thams cad la thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi spyan ni mdo'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos thams cad la thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma eye is the unobstructed knowledge of all the teachings of the twelve branches of excellent speech, such as the discourses and the aphorisms on the discipline.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The buddha eye is the knowledge of all phenomena, such as those with and without impurity, the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: yang na sha'i spyan ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten mthar thug pa med pa na da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can gyi gzugs che phra ci yod pa thams cad la thogs pa med par gzigs te /
analyzed: yang na sha'i spyan ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten mthar thug pa med pa na da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can gyi gzugs che phra ci yod pa thams cad la thogs pa med par gzigs te /
translated: Alternatively, the flesh eye is the unobstructed vision of all the forms of sentient beings, large and small, that exist in the present throughout the worlds of the ten directions, without limit.

original: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra states:

original: de'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad gcig tu mthong //
analyzed: de'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad gcig tu mthong //

analyzed: dpag tshad brgya tshun chad du mthong //

original: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du mthong //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du mthong //

original: shin tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the entire trichiliocosm.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The divine eye is also of two kinds:üîΩthe eye born of karma and the eye born of meditation.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.üîΩHaving obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.

original: las las skyes pa'i mig dang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i mig dang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so //
translated: Having obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.

original: de la las las skyes pa ni lha rnams kyi mig ste /
analyzed: de la las las skyes pa ni lha rnams kyi mig ste /
translated: Having obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.

original: rang gi las kyi shin tu dbang po dang mi'i mig thob na /
analyzed: rang gi las kyi shin tu dbang po dang mi'i mig thob na /
translated: Having obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.üîΩHaving obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.üîΩHaving obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,

original: gzugs dag la thogs pa med par mngon pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dag la thogs pa med par mngon pa'o //
translated: they see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.üîΩHaving obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni rnal 'byor byed pas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni rnal 'byor byed pas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang gnyis so //
translated: Having obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.

original: de la las las skyes pa ni lha rnams kyi mig ste /
analyzed: de la las las skyes pa ni lha rnams kyi mig ste /
translated: Having obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,üîΩthey see forms without obstruction.üîΩThe eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods.üîΩHaving obtained the eye of humans through the power of their karma,
