analyzed: rang gi las kyi shin tu dbang po dang mi'i sems can de dag de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so //
translated: they see forms without obstruction.

original: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so //
analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so //
translated: The eye born of meditation is the result of cultivating concentration.üîΩThe eye born of karma is the eye of the gods

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul du da ltar gyi dus la thug gi bar du gzigs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gzigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul du da ltar gyi dus la thug gi bar du gzigs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gzigs so //
translated: With the eye of supernatural power, he sees past and future forms.

original: de la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan gyis ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnams phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud do //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan gyis ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnams phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud do //
translated: With the eye of noble wisdom, he comprehends without error the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: de la chos kyi spyan zhes bya ba la chos kyi sgras ni gang zag la bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi spyan zhes bya ba la chos kyi sgras ni gang zag la bya ste /
translated: Here, the so-called Dharma eye refers to the individual.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag brgyad dang / sa dang po nas sa bcu man chad kyi byang chub @113a * //

translated: The individual is of various types: the individual of ordinary beings, the eight individuals such as the stream-enterer, and the individuals of the bodhisattvas from the first to tenth grounds.

original: sems dpa'i gang zag rnams kyi sems rgyud ci 'dra ba dang / gang zag la phye na rnam pa du yod pa mkhyen pa ni chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gang zag rnams kyi sems rgyud ci 'dra ba dang / gang zag la phye na rnam pa du yod pa mkhyen pa ni chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the various mind-streams and the various types of individuals is called the Dharma eye.

original: shes par bya ba'i yul shes pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan yin no //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i yul shes pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan yin no //
translated: The eye of a buddha is the direct perception of the entire sphere of objects of knowledge.

original: yang na spyan rnam pa lnga rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na spyan rnam pa lnga rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
translated: Or else, the five eyes are classified as four:

original: gzugs mthong ba dang / don dam pa'i chos mthong ba dang / kun rdzob kyi chos mthong ba dang / shes bya thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba dang / don dam pa'i chos mthong ba dang / kun rdzob kyi chos mthong ba dang / shes bya thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
translated: the eye that sees form, the eye that sees ultimate reality, the eye that sees conventional reality, and the eye that comprehends all objects of knowledge.

original: de la gzugs mthong ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzugs mthong ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The eye that sees form is twofold:

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'o //üîΩlas kyi rnam par smin pa las grub pa'i mig la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'o // las kyi rnam par smin pa las grub pa'i mig la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan zhes bya ste /
translated: that which arises from the evolution of karma and that which is the result of meditative concentration.

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi nang na yod pa'i gzugs kun mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi nang na yod pa'i gzugs kun mthong ngo //
translated: The eye that arises from the evolution of karma is called the ‚Äúeye of supernatural power‚Äù because it sees all forms that exist within a single billion world universe.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi bsgrub pa las thob pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi bsgrub pa las thob pa ste /
translated: The eye that is the result of meditative concentration is obtained through the accomplishment of the four meditations of the form realm.

original: gang gi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i gzugs kun mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i gzugs kun mthong ba ste /
translated: The eye that sees all forms that exist in all the world systems of the ten directions.

original: de la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúdivine eye.‚Äù

original: gang gis don dam pa gang 'gag pa med pa'i chos mthong ba la ni shes rab kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis don dam pa gang 'gag pa med pa'i chos mthong ba la ni shes rab kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that sees the ultimate, the non-cessation of phenomena, is called the ‚Äúeye of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang gis kun rdzob kyi chos mthong ba la ni chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis kun rdzob kyi chos mthong ba la ni chos kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that sees conventional phenomena is called the ‚Äúeye of Dharma.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gzigs pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gzigs pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye that sees all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena and so forth is called the ‚Äúeye of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: yang na sha'i spyan dang rdzu 'phrul la mnga' ste /üîΩsha'i spyan gyis ni da ltar gyi gzugs thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: yang na sha'i spyan dang rdzu 'phrul la mnga' ste / sha'i spyan gyis ni da ltar gyi gzugs thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: Or else, the flesh eye and the eye of supernatural power.üîΩThe flesh eye sees all forms of the present.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: The eye of supernatural power sees all forms of the past and the future.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / snyom par 'jug pa bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams thugs su chud pa ni chos kyi spyan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / snyom par 'jug pa bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams thugs su chud pa ni chos kyi spyan no //
translated: The knowledge of the four meditations, four formless states, and four concentrations is the Dharma eye.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam dang / las bdag gi dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi spyan no //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam dang / las bdag gi dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi spyan no //
translated: The knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, of the karma of each being, of the various aspirations, and of the various elements is the eye of wisdom.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa zad par bya ba mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa zad par bya ba mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of the outflows by the noble arhats and tathagatas, following the vajra-like concentration, is the buddha eye.

original: lung nod pa ni mngon par @113b shes pa ste /
analyzed: lung nod pa ni mngon par @113b shes pa ste /
translated: The prediction is the superknowledge.

original: rim bzhin du de dag kyang skad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rim bzhin du de dag kyang skad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa las lung nod pa dang / bdag gis mnos pa'i lung sems can la bstan pa yang /
translated: The prediction from the Tathagata himself, and the teaching of the prediction that one has received to sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa rnams kyis lung mnod cing gzhan la ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa rnams kyis lung mnod cing gzhan la ston par byed pa'o //
translated: He recites and teaches others the scriptures by means of the superknowledges of magical power, the divine eye, the divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, recollection of former lives, knowledge of death and rebirth, and knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: de yang rim bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sems can gyi gnas de dang de dag tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rim bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sems can gyi gnas de dang de dag tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: By the superknowledge of magical power, he goes to the various buddha-fields and abodes of beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang sems can gyi lus ngag mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang sems can gyi lus ngag mthong ngo //
translated: By the divine eye, he sees the bodies of the Tathagatas and of beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rna bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs dang / sems can gyi skad sna tshogs thos so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rna bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs dang / sems can gyi skad sna tshogs thos so //
translated: By the divine ear, he hears the voices of the Tathagatas and the various sounds of beings.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas ni sems can ci dang ci sems pa rnams khong du chud do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas ni sems can ci dang ci sems pa rnams khong du chud do //
translated: By knowledge of others' minds, he understands the various thoughts of beings.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas ni sems can dag 'das pa'i dus nas gang nas 'phos te gang nas gang du shi 'phros te gang du skyes pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas ni sems can dag 'das pa'i dus nas gang nas 'phos te gang nas gang du shi 'phros te gang du skyes pa mthong ngo //
translated: By the superknowledge of recollecting former lives, one sees that sentient beings have transmigrated from a previous time, from where they died and transmigrated, and where they were born.

original: 'chi 'pho shes pas ni sems can dag 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe rabs phyi mar gang nas gang du skyes pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho shes pas ni sems can dag 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe rabs phyi mar gang nas gang du skyes pa mthong ba'o //
translated: By the superknowledge of death and rebirth, one sees that sentient beings die here and are reborn in a future life.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa yod pa zad par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa las kyang lung nod cing sems can la yang lung ston par byed do //üîΩgnas pas rnam par rtsen pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

translated: By the superknowledge of the extinction of the outflows, one receives the prediction of Buddhahood from the Tathagatas and also gives predictions to sentient beings in order to extinguish the afflictions that exist in the mind-streams of oneself and others.

analyzed: gnas pas rnam par rtsen pa mngon par bsgrub pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams rdzu 'phrul dang sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du ting nge 'dzin rnam pa du ma la 'jug pa dang ldan pas
translated: The accomplishment of the play of abiding is as follows: By the power of various miracles and emanations, the bodhisattvas enter into many kinds of meditative absorptions in the retinue of the ma·πá·∏çala of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: rol par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rol par byed pa'o //
translated: They play.

original: smon pa ni gang //
analyzed: smon pa ni gang //
translated: What is aspiration?

original: smon pas shes pa'i smon pa'i mthus //
analyzed: smon pas shes pa'i smon pa'i mthus //
translated: By the power of the knowledge of aspiration,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: smon lam gyi mthu las skyes pa'i ye shes de'i dbang gis smon lam ji ltar btab pa bzhin du //üîΩlha @114a * //
analyzed: smon lam gyi mthu las skyes pa'i ye shes de'i dbang gis smon lam ji ltar btab pa bzhin du // lha @114a * //
translated: By the power of that knowledge that arises from the power of aspiration, just as aspired,

original: dang mi la sogs pa'i skyes gnas de dang de dag tu ci dgar 'byung zhing sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad pas rol pa'o //
analyzed: dang mi la sogs pa'i skyes gnas de dang de dag tu ci dgar 'byung zhing sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad pas rol pa'o //
translated: they play by being born in various places such as the god realm, the human realm, and so on, and accomplishing various benefits for sentient beings.

original: de dag gi lus dang mthu dang sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag gi lus dang mthu dang sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Their bodies, power, and sound are not easy to measure.üîΩHaving been born in this and that birthplace through the power of aspiration, they enjoy benefiting sentient beings.

original: smon lam gyi skyen gnas de dang de dag tu skyes nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas rnam par rol pa ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: smon lam gyi skyen gnas de dang de dag tu skyes nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas rnam par rol pa ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra of the Ten Stages also says:

original: de dag gi lus dang mthu dang sgra rnams bgrang bar sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gi lus dang mthu dang sgra rnams bgrang bar sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Their bodies, power, and sound are not easy to measure.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba la smon lam gyi dbang gis skye gnas de dang de dag tu skyes pa'i byang chub pa'i sems dpa' de dang de dag gis zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba la smon lam gyi dbang gis skye gnas de dang de dag tu skyes pa'i byang chub pa'i sems dpa' de dang de dag gis zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútheir‚Äù is that those bodhisattvas who have been born in this and that birthplace through the power of aspiration are those bodhisattvas.

original: de dag gi lus kyi yon tan dang / sems kyi mthu'i yon tan dang / sgra dbyangs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i bde bar brjod du sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi lus kyi yon tan dang / sems kyi mthu'i yon tan dang / sgra dbyangs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i bde bar brjod du sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that their bodies, their mental power, their sound, and so forth are not easy to express.

original: dbang byed pa ni de nyid ji ltar dbang bcu bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la dbang mngon par sgrub pa ni sa bcu pa'i mdo nyid las ji ltar dbang bcur bshad pa rnams bsgrubs te /üîΩtshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: dbang byed pa ni de nyid ji ltar dbang bcu bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la dbang mngon par sgrub pa ni sa bcu pa'i mdo nyid las ji ltar dbang bcur bshad pa rnams bsgrubs te / tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
translated: Mastery is the ten masteries, as they are taught in the Ten Stages itself.

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of life, mastery of mind, mastery of equipment, mastery of action, mastery of rebirth, mastery of aspiration, mastery of prayer, mastery of intuitive wisdom, mastery of the Dharma, and mastery of the support.

original: de la tshe la dbang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthus tshe'i 'du byed byin gyi rlabs ji srid 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshe la dbang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthus tshe'i 'du byed byin gyi rlabs ji srid 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa'o //
translated: Mastery of life is the bodhisattvas' ability to remain for as long as they wish by the power of their cultivation of the four bases of supernormal powers.üîΩMastery of mind is the ability to enter meditative concentration whenever they wish.

original: sems la dbang ba ni ji srid 'dod pa bzhin du theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems la dbang ba ni ji srid 'dod pa bzhin du theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Mastery of mind is the ability to enter into the innumerable samadhis of the Mahayana for as long as one wishes.

original: yo byad la dbang ba ni byin gyis brlabs nas nam mkha' la yo byad sna tshogs kyi char phab ste /
analyzed: yo byad la dbang ba ni byin gyis brlabs nas nam mkha' la yo byad sna tshogs kyi char phab ste /
translated: Mastery of equipment is the ability to rain down various kinds of equipment from the sky by blessing it.

original: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to benefit sentient beings.

original: las dbang ba ni lus dang ngag gi las kyis sprul pa sna tshogs byed pa'am /
analyzed: las dbang ba ni lus dang ngag gi las kyis sprul pa sna tshogs byed pa'am /
translated: Mastery of karma is the ability to perform various emanations by means of physical and verbal karma.

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas gzhan du skyes pa'i las dag byin gyis brlabs nas khams dang 'gro ba gzhan du skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas gzhan du skyes pa'i las dag byin gyis brlabs nas khams dang 'gro ba gzhan du skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, having blessed the karma of being born in other realms, migrations, and birth states, one is able to be born in other realms and migrations.

original: skye ba la dbang ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan la gnas shing de yang yongs su ma nyams par sems can gyi don du @114b 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan la gnas shing de yang yongs su ma nyams par sems can gyi don du @114b 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
translated: Mastery of birth is the ability to be born in the desire realm for the sake of sentient beings without losing the dhyanas of the form realm.

original: mos pa la dbang ba ni sa la sogs pa chu la sogs par mos pas ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pa la dbang ba ni sa la sogs pa chu la sogs par mos pas ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Mastery of aspiration is the ability to transform earth into water and so on by aspiring to do so.

original: smon lam la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i smon lam chen po grangs med pa mngon par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i smon lam chen po grangs med pa mngon par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Mastery of prayer is the accomplishment of innumerable great prayers which accomplish the abundant benefit of self and other just as one wishes.

original: de yang ji ltar sa bcu'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sa bcu'i mdo las /
translated: And that is as it is said in the Sutra of the Ten Stages:

original: sa dang po la smon lam chen po bcu gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩrdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni sems can rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sa dang po la smon lam chen po bcu gsungs pa la sogs pa'o // rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni sems can rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: On the first stage, there are ten great prayers.

original: 'bar ba dang 'phul ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul dpag tu med pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang 'phul ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul dpag tu med pa ston pa'o //
translated: Mastery of miracles is the display of countless miracles and wonders, such as blazing with fire and flying through space, in order to generate faith in sentient beings.

original: ye shes la dbang ba'i chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams rab kyi mthar phyin pa rnams thob pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba'i chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams rab kyi mthar phyin pa rnams thob pa'o //
translated: Mastery of intuition is the attainment of the ultimate perfection of the Dharma, the meaning, the etymological interpretation, and the eloquence.

original: chos la dbang ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams sems can thams cad la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis bshad nas sems tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dbang ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams sems can thams cad la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis bshad nas sems tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: Mastery of Dharma is the satisfaction of the minds of all sentient beings through the explanation of the Dharmas of the sutras, etc., with various collections of names, phrases, and letters.

original: de la tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang gsum ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa las thob ste /
analyzed: de la tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang gsum ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa las thob ste /
translated: Mastery of life, mastery of mind, and mastery of requisites are obtained from perfecting the transcendent perfections of generosity,

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas tshe la dbang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas tshe la dbang ba thob pa'o //
translated: mastery of life is obtained through the generosity of fearlessness.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sems la dbang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sems la dbang ba thob pa'o //
translated: Mastery of mind is obtained through the generosity of Dharma.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pas ni yo byad la dbang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pas ni yo byad la dbang ba thob pa'o //
translated: Mastery of requisites is obtained through the generosity of material things.

original: las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'thob ste /
analyzed: las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'thob ste /
translated: Mastery of action and mastery of birth are obtained through the power of perfecting transcendent discipline.

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pas ni lus kyi sprul pa sna tshogs byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pas ni lus kyi sprul pa sna tshogs byed do //
translated: Through the complete purity of physical action, one performs various physical emanations.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pas ni dag gi sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pas ni dag gi sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //
translated: Through the complete purity of verbal action, one performs various verbal emanations.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ni gang du skye bar 'dod pa der skye ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ni gang du skye bar 'dod pa der skye ba'i phyir ro//
translated: And through the complete purity of discipline, one is born wherever one wishes.

original: mos pa la dbang ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'thob ste /
analyzed: mos pa la dbang ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'thob ste /
translated: Mastery of aspiration is attained through the power of perfecting the transcendent perfection of tolerance.

original: bzod pas sems can gzhan gyi sems ma dkrugs shing yid dang mthun par byas pas gang dang gang ji ltar mos pa brgyad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bzod pas sems can gzhan gyi sems ma dkrugs shing yid dang mthun par byas pas gang dang gang ji ltar mos pa brgyad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Through tolerance, one does not disturb the minds of other beings and acts in harmony with their minds.

original: de dang de dag de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de dag de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, whatever one aspires to, in whatever way one aspires to it, it is accomplished just as aspired.

original: smon lam la dbang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub ste //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyis sngon bdag dang gzhan @115a * //
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub ste // brtson 'grus kyis sngon bdag dang gzhan @115a * //
translated: Mastery of prayer is accomplished through the power of perfecting the transcendent perfection of effort.

original: gyi don 'grub pas phyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur bar ji ltar smon lam btab pa de bzhin du 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi don 'grub pas phyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur bar ji ltar smon lam btab pa de bzhin du 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Through effort, one accomplishes the aims of oneself and others in the past, and thus accomplishes the aims of oneself and others in the future, just as one has prayed.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub po //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub po //
translated: Mastery of magical powers is accomplished through the power of perfecting the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration.

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub bo //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthu las 'grub bo //
translated: Mastery of intuition and mastery of teaching are accomplished through the power of perfecting the transcendence of wisdom.

original: chos thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi chos sgrub pa ni chos thob pa mngon par grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi chos sgrub pa ni chos thob pa mngon par grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the Dharma and so on refers to the accomplishment of the Dharma of the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and eighteen distinctive qualities, which is called the realization of the attainment of the Dharma.

original: dbang po rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu dbang po'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa de de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i dbang
analyzed: dbang po rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu dbang po'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa de de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i dbang
translated: In the analysis of the faculties, there is a verse.

original: po lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: po lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the faculties after the section on the bases of psychic power? Thus, after cultivating the bases of psychic power, the mind becomes one-pointed. After that, the five faculties arise that lead to the realization of supramundane dharmas.

original: de bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the section on the faculties after the bases of psychic power is connected.

original: de la dbang po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po ni lnga ste /
translated: The faculties are five in number:

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la yod pa dang / de la yod pa dang / yon tan can dang / nus pa'i dngos po la rim bzhin du yid ches pa dang / sems dad pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yod pa dang / de la yod pa dang / yon tan can dang / nus pa'i dngos po la rim bzhin du yid ches pa dang / sems dad pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith is the inclination of the mind toward a thing that is considered possible, real, good, and able to be done.

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yod pa la ni yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yod pa la ni yid ches pa'o //
translated: It is the inclination of the mind toward the existence of action and result, etc.

original: dkon mchog gsum du la sogs pa yon tan can la ni sems dang ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum du la sogs pa yon tan can la ni sems dang ngo //
translated: It is the confidence of the mind toward the good qualities of the Three Jewels, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bsgrub par nus //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bsgrub par nus //
translated: It is the desire to accomplish nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par nus pa la /üîΩbsgrub pa dang bsgom pa la 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par nus pa la / bsgrub pa dang bsgom pa la 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: It is the desire to accomplish the noble path.

original: yang na chos bzhi la dad pa ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chos bzhi la dad pa ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, faith is the inclination of the mind toward the four noble truths.

original: chos bzhi ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i chos zab mo dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rgya che ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos bzhi ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i chos zab mo dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rgya che ba'i chos so //
translated: The four dharmas are: virtue, nonvirtue, their results, and the profound Dharma of the bodhisattva practices and the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and the vast Dharma of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra says,

original: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na //
analyzed: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na //
translated: What is the faculty of faith?

original: dad pa gang gis chos bzhi pa dad pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang gis chos bzhi pa dad pa ste /
translated: It is faith in the four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'khor ba la spyod pa 'jig rten @115b pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba la spyod pa 'jig rten @115b pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad de /
translated: They are faith in the correct view of worldly persons who engage in cyclic existence,

original: de las kyi rnam par smin pa'i phyir 'brang ba yin pas dge ba'am sdig pa'am las gang byas pa de dang de'i rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: de las kyi rnam par smin pa'i phyir 'brang ba yin pas dge ba'am sdig pa'am las gang byas pa de dang de'i rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: and faith in the ripening of karma, thinking, ‚ÄúWhatever karma I have created, virtuous or nonvirtuous, I will experience the ripening of that.‚Äù

original: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa la ste /
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa la ste /
translated: Not to commit evil deeds even at the cost of one's life, and to have faith in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: spyod pa de la zhugs nas kyang theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa skyed pa dang / chos thams cad la don dam par nges pa'i don zab mo rten cing 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: spyod pa de la zhugs nas kyang theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa skyed pa dang / chos thams cad la don dam par nges pa'i don zab mo rten cing 'brel ba ste /
translated: Having entered into those deeds, to not generate desire for other vehicles, and to have faith in the profound definitive meaning of all phenomena, which is the ultimate, dependent origination,

original: 'byung ba bdag med pas sems can med pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba bdag med pas sems can med pa /
translated: which is devoid of self, devoid of sentient beings,

original: srog med pa /üîΩgso ba med pa /
analyzed: srog med pa / gso ba med pa /
translated: devoid of life,

original: gang zag med pa //üîΩrnam par spyod cing stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang ; / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du dad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag med pa // rnam par spyod cing stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang ; / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du dad pa ste /
translated: devoid of persons,üîΩand devoid of individuals.

original: lta bar 'gyur ba thams cad bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa ste /
analyzed: lta bar 'gyur ba thams cad bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa ste /
translated: To not harbor any latent tendencies toward any views, and to have faith in all the qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: dad pa'i phyir the tshom dang bral //
analyzed: dad pa'i phyir the tshom dang bral //
translated: Because of faith, one is free from doubt.

original: nem nur dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yang dag par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: nem nur dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yang dag par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Free from uncertainty, one accomplishes those qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the faculty of faith.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la gnas pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la gnas pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of effort is the basis of the four right efforts.

original: yang na dad pa'i dbang pos yid ches par bya ba'i chos de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos sgrub par byed de //
analyzed: yang na dad pa'i dbang pos yid ches par bya ba'i chos de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos sgrub par byed de //
translated: Or, the faculty of faith is the faith in the Dharma to be practiced, and the faculty of effort is the practice of that Dharma.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says,

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na //
