translated: This is called the power of mindfulness.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni yul sems g-yengs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni yul sems g-yengs pa ste /
translated: The adverse factors of meditative concentration are the distraction of objects and the distraction of the mind.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu chung bas yul gang gis kyang sems g-yengs bar byed mi nus shing zhum pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu chung bas yul gang gis kyang sems g-yengs bar byed mi nus shing zhum pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of samadhi is the ability to remain unmoved by any object, because the opposing forces are weak. One is not carried away by discouragement or excitement.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati Sutra says,

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the power of samadhi?

original: gang 'du 'dzi thams cad las dben par gnas @117b shing spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'du 'dzi thams cad las dben par gnas @117b shing spyod pa ste /
translated: It is the practice of solitude in all busyness.

original: de sgra dang tshig gi lam thams cad kyis shin du ston kyang /
analyzed: de sgra dang tshig gi lam thams cad kyis shin du ston kyang /
translated: Even though one teaches extensively by means of all the paths of words and sounds,

original: de bsam gtan dang po la sgrib par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po la sgrib par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: one does not obscure the first samadhi.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The obscuration to wisdom is false wisdom.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyam chung bas gang la yang the tshom med par gyur cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad shes pa ni shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyam chung bas gang la yang the tshom med par gyur cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad shes pa ni shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of wisdom is the absence of doubt about anything, due to the weakness of adverse factors, and the knowledge of all supramundane qualities.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: de la shes rab kyi stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi stobs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the power of wisdom?

original: gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that is not overcome by supramundane qualities.

original: skyes shing byung na yang slob dpon med par bzo'i gnas dang rig pa dang sngags dang stobs kyis bsam gtan mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes shing byung na yang slob dpon med par bzo'i gnas dang rig pa dang sngags dang stobs kyis bsam gtan mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even when they have arisen, they are not dependent on a master, and through the power of their knowledge, arts, and spells, they actualize the meditative concentrations.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Seven verses on the divisions of the factors of enlightenment.

original: stobs lnga'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag gi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: stobs lnga'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag gi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the five powers and the factors of enlightenment, which are to be explained?

original: de ltar stobs kyi skabs su ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams kyis bar du gcod par bya bar mi nus par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar stobs kyi skabs su ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams kyis bar du gcod par bya bar mi nus par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, when one is in the stage of the powers, one is no longer able to be obstructed by lack of faith, laziness, loss of mindfulness, distraction, and confused understanding.

original: de ma thag tu sa dang po thob nas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de ma thag tu sa dang po thob nas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Immediately after that, one attains the first stage and cultivates the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi skabs bshad par 'brel te /
analyzed: stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi skabs bshad par 'brel te /
translated: Therefore, the seven factors of enlightenment are explained immediately after the powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yang tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yang tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan to //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are also taught in seven verses.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin du sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin du sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are the factor of enlightenment of mindfulness, the factor of enlightenment of the investigation of things, the factor of enlightenment of energy, the factor of enlightenment of joy, the factor of enlightenment of pliancy,

original: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: the limb of enlightenment that is equanimity.

original: de la dran pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin pas byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms shing mngon sum du byas pa rnams sems la gsal bar yod cing ma brjed pa ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin pas byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms shing mngon sum du byas pa rnams sems la gsal bar yod cing ma brjed pa ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the side of meditative serenity. Thus, the limb of enlightenment that is mindfulness is the clarity and non-forgetfulness of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment that have been cultivated and actualized in the mind.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the limb of enlightenment that is mindfulness?

original: dran pa gang gis chos rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / chos rnams la so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la @118a * //
analyzed: dran pa gang gis chos rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / chos rnams la so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la @118a * //
translated: It is that mindfulness by which one realizes the teachings and discriminates the teachings.

original: sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i don kyang ma brjed pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i don kyang ma brjed pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúrealization‚Äù and so on should be understood as non-forgetfulness.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin te /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin te /
translated: Discriminating wisdom is the side of transcendent insight.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi dus na spang bar bya ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / blang bar bya ba'i chos rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par shes pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi dus na spang bar bya ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / blang bar bya ba'i chos rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par shes pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: At the time of the path of seeing, the knowledge of the characteristics of the phenomena to be abandoned, the phenomena of the side of complete affliction, and the phenomena to be adopted, the phenomena of the side of complete purification, without mixing them up, is called the limb of enlightenment of the thorough discrimination of phenomena.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said:

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the limb of enlightenment of the thorough discrimination of phenomena?

original: gang chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnam par 'byed par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnam par 'byed par shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that thoroughly discriminates the eighty-four thousand components of phenomena.

original: chos gang dang gang ji lta bur rnam par 'byed pa nges pa'i don yang nges pa'i don drang ba'i don yang drang ba'i don du /
analyzed: chos gang dang gang ji lta bur rnam par 'byed pa nges pa'i don yang nges pa'i don drang ba'i don yang drang ba'i don du /
translated: It is the thorough discrimination of any phenomenon whatsoever, the knowledge that is the discrimination of the definitive meaning as definitive meaning, and the discrimination of the interpretable meaning as interpretable meaning,

original: kun rdzob kyi don yang kun rdzob kyi don du /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi don yang kun rdzob kyi don du /
translated: the discrimination of the conventional meaning as conventional meaning,

original: don dam pa'i don yang don par brda'ang brdar /
analyzed: don dam pa'i don yang don par brda'ang brdar /
translated: and the discrimination of the ultimate meaning as ultimate meaning.

original: gdon mi za ba yang gdon mi za bar chos de dang de dag de lta bur rnam par 'byed pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba yang gdon mi za bar chos de dang de dag de lta bur rnam par 'byed pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the right discrimination of dharmas, a factor of awakening.

original: de la yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams len par byed cing yon tan de thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa rnams spong bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams len par byed cing yon tan de thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa rnams spong bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The right effort of awakening is the effort to take up the higher, special virtues and to eliminate the faults that obstruct the attainment of those virtues.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says,

original: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the right effort of awakening?

original: gang dran pa 'di dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang dran pa 'di dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is the effort to remember the discrimination of dharmas, and so on, up to

original: lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the effort to realize the path.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the right effort of awakening.‚Äù

original: sa dang pos gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chung nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: sa dang pos gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chung nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
translated: Having understood the selflessness of persons and of phenomena on the first ground, one realizes the nature of the expanse of reality that is omnipresent.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa dang bral nas lus dang sems la dga' ba'i mchog skyes pa ni dga' pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa dang bral nas lus dang sems la dga' ba'i mchog skyes pa ni dga' pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Having become free of the obscurations that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing, one experiences the highest joy in body and mind. This is called the factor of perfect enlightenment that is joy.

original: de bas na sa dang po la yang sa rab tu dga' ba zhes btags so //
analyzed: de bas na sa dang po la yang sa rab tu dga' ba zhes btags so //
translated: Therefore, the first ground is also called the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: For this reason, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the factor of perfect enlightenment that is joy?

original: chos la dga' ba dang / chos la mos pa dang zhes bya @118b ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba dang / chos la mos pa dang zhes bya @118b ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is joy in the Dharma, interest in the Dharma, and so on.

original: lus las su rung sems las su rung bar gyur na lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len dang bral te /
analyzed: lus las su rung sems las su rung bar gyur na lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len dang bral te /
translated: When one has physical and mental flexibility, one is free of the negative tendencies of physical and mental inflexibility.

original: lus las su rung bar byas pa la zo mdog bde ba dang / sems las su rung bas dmigs pa'i yul la thogs pa med par 'jug pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus las su rung bar byas pa la zo mdog bde ba dang / sems las su rung bas dmigs pa'i yul la thogs pa med par 'jug pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The pliancy of body is the comfort of complexion. The pliancy of thought is the unhindered engagement with the object of meditation. This is called the enlightenment-factor of pliancy.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa says,

original: de la shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the enlightenment-factor of pliancy?

original: gang lus shin tu byang bar gyur pa dang / sems shin tu byang bar gyur pas nyon mongs pa bsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang lus shin tu byang bar gyur pa dang / sems shin tu byang bar gyur pas nyon mongs pa bsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is the clearing away of afflictions by means of the pliancy of body and the pliancy of thought.

original: de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: One-pointedness of thought focused on reality, the ultimate expanse, is called the enlightenment-factor of meditative concentration.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states,

original: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the enlightenment-factor of meditative concentration?

original: gang sems mnyam par bzhag pas chos kyi ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang sems mnyam par bzhag pas chos kyi ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The mind that is in equipoise realizes the wisdom of phenomena, not the mind that is not in equipoise.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs nas zhum pa dang rgod pa med par gnas pa ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs nas zhum pa dang rgod pa med par gnas pa ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The absence of laxity and excitement is called the branch of enlightenment of correct equanimity.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa says,

original: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of enlightenment of correct equanimity?

original: gang 'di yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i phyogs kyis sems kun nas mi gzung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / mthon dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi bsgul ba yin te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'di yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i phyogs kyis sems kun nas mi gzung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / mthon dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi bsgul ba yin te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is the mental state that is not seized by the side of mental pleasure or mental pain, that is not carried away by worldly things, and that is unshakable because it does not stand on high or low.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs su gzhag go //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs su gzhag go //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are to be posited as the side of calm, the side of insight, and the side of both.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: The three of discrimination of phenomena, effort, and joy are the side of insight.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: The three of pliancy, concentration, and equanimity are the side of calm.

original: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs te kun du 'gro bas so //üîΩsar zhugs pa yi byang chub kyi //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs te kun du 'gro bas so // sar zhugs pa yi byang chub kyi //
translated: Mindfulness is the side of both because it is omnipresent.

original: yan lag rnam gzhag shes par bya //
analyzed: yan lag rnam gzhag shes par bya //
translated: One should know the presentation of the factors of enlightenmentüîΩof one who has entered the grounds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig @119a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig @119a * //
translated: One verse on the presentation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: gis gang gi dus na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang shes pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gis gang gi dus na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang shes pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: At what time are the seven factors of enlightenment presented? And by what knowledge are the seven factors of enlightenment presented?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni sa dang po la zhugs shing sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i tshe yan lag bdun la bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni sa dang po la zhugs shing sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i tshe yan lag bdun la bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ste /
translated: The seven bodhi factors are the knowledge that the seven factors are to be cultivated when one has entered the first stage and attained the stage of The Joyful One.

original: 'dis ni gang gi dus na rnam par gzhag pa ste de bstan to //üîΩchos dang sems thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang gi dus na rnam par gzhag pa ste de bstan to // chos dang sems thams cad kyi //
translated: This shows the time when they are to be cultivated.üîΩThe equality of all phenomena and mind

original: mnyam pa nyid ni shes pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni shes pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir sa dang po'i dus na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa dang po'i dus na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the seven bodhi factors to be cultivated on the first stage?

original: de'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid khong du chud de /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid khong du chud de /
translated: At that time one comprehends the selflessness of phenomena and persons and comprehends the equality of self and others.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid shes pas na sa dang po'i tshe na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams la mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid shes pas na sa dang po'i tshe na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, because one knows the equality of phenomena and knows the equality of all sentient beings, the seven bodhi factors are to be cultivated on the first stage.

original: de chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas chos la mnyam pa nyid shes so //
analyzed: de chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas chos la mnyam pa nyid shes so //
translated: By penetrating the selflessness of phenomena, one knows the sameness of phenomena.

original: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes so //
translated: By penetrating the selflessness of persons, one knows the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: yang na chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas na chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid shes so //
analyzed: yang na chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas na chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid shes so //
translated: Or, by penetrating the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one knows the sameness of phenomena.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pas na sems can gyi mnyam pa nyid shes so//
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pas na sems can gyi mnyam pa nyid shes so//
translated: By penetrating the sameness of self and other, one knows the sameness of sentient beings.

original: yang na sa dang po'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas na chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid khong du chud do //
analyzed: yang na sa dang po'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas na chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid khong du chud do //
translated: Or, by realizing on the first ground that the dharmadhƒÅtu is the nature of all phenomena, one penetrates the sameness of phenomena.

original: de ltar khong du chud pas bdag gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyang de nyid yin /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pas bdag gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyang de nyid yin /
translated: By penetrating that, one knows that whatever is the self is also all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang yin pa bdag kyang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang yin pa bdag kyang de nyid yin te /
translated: And whatever are all sentient beings is also the self.

original: ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as one seeks to eliminate one‚Äôs own suffering,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yang zhi bar bya'o zhes khong du chud pas na sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid shes so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yang zhi bar bya'o zhes khong du chud pas na sems can thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid shes so zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, they know the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni gang shes pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag pa de bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang shes pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag pa de bstan to //
translated: This shows the knowledge by which the factors of enlightenment are defined.üîΩThe factors of enlightenment are like the seven jewels of a world-emperor.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'khor lo la sogs pa rin po che bdun dang 'dra bas bstan to zhes bya ba la 'di man chad kyi tshigs su bcad pas dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'khor lo la sogs pa rin po che bdun dang 'dra bas bstan to zhes bya ba la 'di man chad kyi tshigs su bcad pas dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la /
translated: The following verse shows that, beginning with the wheel, the factors of enlightenment are like the seven jewels of a world-emperor.

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / kun @119b mgon rin po che dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / kun @119b mgon rin po che dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a world-emperor possesses the jewel of the wheel, the jewel of the elephant, the jewel of the horse, the jewel of the queen, the jewel of the steward, the jewel of the military advisor, and the jewel of the priest,

original: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar dran pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ston to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar dran pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first stage is like a universal monarch, and the seven branches of enlightenment such as mindfulness are like the precious wheel and so on.

original: shes bya kun la dran spyod pa //üîΩma rgyal ba las rgyal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: shes bya kun la dran spyod pa // ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba'i phyir //
translated: The branch of enlightenment of mindfulness

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is like the precious wheel.

original: dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor lo rin po che dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor lo rin po che dang 'dra ste /
translated: The branch of enlightenment of mindfulness is like the precious wheel.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pa'i 'khor lo rin po ches rdzongs dang mkhar la gnas pa'i rgyal phran ma rgyal ba rnams las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir gnas te /üîΩde dag tu 'jug pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pa'i 'khor lo rin po ches rdzongs dang mkhar la gnas pa'i rgyal phran ma rgyal ba rnams las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir gnas te / de dag tu 'jug pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the precious wheel of a universal monarch is set in motion in order to conquer the minor kings who have not been conquered.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang shes bya ma rgyal ba las rgyal te /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang shes bya ma rgyal ba las rgyal te /
translated: In the same way, the branch of enlightenment of correct mindfulness conquers the objects of knowledge that have not been conquered.

original: mngon sum du mi shes pa rnams shes shing rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi shes pa rnams shes shing rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug ste /
translated: One enters in order to know and conquer those objects of knowledge that are not yet known and conquered.

original: shes bya rgyal ba'i sa dang po'o //
analyzed: shes bya rgyal ba'i sa dang po'o //
translated: The first stage of the Victorious One is the object of knowledge.

original: ma rgyal ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste dran pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa spangs nas sa dang po mngon sum du byed pas na shes bya ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed pas so //
analyzed: ma rgyal ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste dran pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa spangs nas sa dang po mngon sum du byed pas na shes bya ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed pas so //
translated: The stage of devoted engagement is not yet victorious. Having abandoned the stage of devoted engagement through mindfulness, one actualizes the first stage, and thus one conquers the object of knowledge that is not yet conquered.

original: rtog pa'i mtshan ma kun 'joms pa ;
analyzed: rtog pa'i mtshan ma kun 'joms pa ;
translated: It conquers all signs of conceptual thought.

original: / de ni rab tu 'byed pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de ni rab tu 'byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the thorough differentiation.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i glang po rin po che dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i glang po rin po che dang 'dra ste /
translated: The branch of enlightenment that is the thorough differentiation of phenomena is like the precious elephant of a universal monarch.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na glang po rin po ches phas kyi rgol pa'i dpung dmag gi sde rnams 'joms par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na glang po rin po ches phas kyi rgol pa'i dpung dmag gi sde rnams 'joms par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the precious elephant conquers the armies of adversaries.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang gang zag tu rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos su rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad 'joms par byed pas na glang po rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang gang zag tu rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos su rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad 'joms par byed pas na glang po rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: And the limb of enlightenment of thorough analysis of phenomena is like the precious elephant, because it destroys all signs of the conceptualization of persons and all signs of the conceptualization of phenomena.

original: yang na rtog pa'i sgras ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i chos la bya la /
analyzed: yang na rtog pa'i sgras ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i chos la bya la /
translated: Alternatively, the word ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù refers to the phenomena that are the apprehending subject, such as the eye faculty, etc.

original: mtshan ma'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung cha la bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung cha la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúsign‚Äù refers to the objects that are apprehended, such as form, etc.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma thams cad spong bar byed pas na glang po rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma thams cad spong bar byed pas na glang po rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: The limb of enlightenment of thorough analysis of phenomena is like the precious elephant, because it eliminates all signs of the apprehended object and apprehending subject by means of the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: myur du ma lus shes bya'i phyir //
analyzed: myur du ma lus shes bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to quickly and completely understand all objects of knowledge,

original: de yi brtson 'grus rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de yi brtson 'grus rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: he engages in effort.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rta rin po che dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rta rin po che dang 'dra ste /
translated: The requisite of enlightenment that is right effort is like the precious horse of a universal emperor.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rta rin po ches ji srid du 'khor par bya ba'i gnas rgya mtsho'i mtha'i bar du myur du 'gro bar byed pa de bzhin du /üîΩbrtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @120a * //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rta rin po ches ji srid du 'khor par bya ba'i gnas rgya mtsho'i mtha'i bar du myur du 'gro bar byed pa de bzhin du / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @120a * //
translated: Just as the precious horse of a universal emperor quickly goes wherever he wishes to go, up to the edge of the ocean,üîΩso too the requisite of enlightenment that is right effort quickly obtains the superknowledges such as the eye of miraculous action.

original: gis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams thob par bya ba myur du 'thob par byed pas na rta rin po che dang 'dra'o //üîΩchos kyi snang ba rnams 'phel bas //
analyzed: gis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams thob par bya ba myur du 'thob par byed pas na rta rin po che dang 'dra'o // chos kyi snang ba rnams 'phel bas //
translated: It is like the precious horse.üîΩIt always fills one with joy

original: rtag tu dga' bas gang bar byed //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' bas gang bar byed //
translated: by increasing the light of Dharma.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i nor bu rin po che'i snang ba'i khyad par gyis mun pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de la dga' ba'i khyad par rtag tu skyed pa de bzhin
analyzed: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i nor bu rin po che'i snang ba'i khyad par gyis mun pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de la dga' ba'i khyad par rtag tu skyed pa de bzhin
translated: The limb of enlightenment of joy is like the special appearance of the precious jewel of a universal monarch, which always generates a special joy in that universal monarch by dispelling darkness and so on.

original: du / sa dang po'i tshe chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas dga' ba'i khyad par skye ste /
analyzed: du / sa dang po'i tshe chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas dga' ba'i khyad par skye ste /
translated: Similarly, when one realizes at the time of the first bhumi that the dharmadhatu is the nature of all phenomena, a special joy arises.

original: dga' ba des kyang byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang sems la mchog tu dga' ba'i shes pa skyes pas na nor bu rin po che snang ba'i khyad par dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dga' ba des kyang byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang sems la mchog tu dga' ba'i shes pa skyes pas na nor bu rin po che snang ba'i khyad par dang 'dra'o //
translated: And because that joy gives rise to a supreme blissful awareness in the body and mind of the bodhisattva, it is like the special appearance of the precious jewel.

original: sgrib pa kun las thar pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las thar pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of being free from all obscurations,

original: shin tu sbyangs las bde ba thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs las bde ba thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: bliss is attained from pliancy.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i btsun mo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i btsun mo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is perfect ease is like the precious queen of a universal monarch.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i btsun mo rin po che dgun la sogs pa'i grang ba'i dus na ni lus kyi mthang dro bar gyur nas grang ba bsal te 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dga' ba rjes su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i btsun mo rin po che dgun la sogs pa'i grang ba'i dus na ni lus kyi mthang dro bar gyur nas grang ba bsal te 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dga' ba rjes su myong bar byed do //
translated: For example, in the cold season and so on, the precious queen of a universal monarch warms her body and removes the cold, and she experiences the joy of the universal monarch.

original: dbyar la sogs pa dro ba'i dus na ni lus kyi mthang bsil bar gyur nas dro ba bsal bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dga' ba rjes su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: dbyar la sogs pa dro ba'i dus na ni lus kyi mthang bsil bar gyur nas dro ba bsal bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dga' ba rjes su myong bar byed do //
translated: In the warm season and so on, she cools her body and removes the heat, and she experiences the joy of the universal monarch.

original: de bzhin du shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus las su rung ba dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus las su rung ba dang sems las su rung ba la bya ste /
translated: Similarly, ease is physical pliancy and mental pliancy.

original: de gnyis kyis lus las su mi rung ba dang / sems las su mi rung ba bsal nas lus las su rung ba dang sems las su rung ba'i bde ba rjes su myong bar byed pas na btsun mo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis lus las su mi rung ba dang / sems las su mi rung ba bsal nas lus las su rung ba dang sems las su rung ba'i bde ba rjes su myong bar byed pas na btsun mo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since those two eliminate unserviceability of the body and unserviceability of mind and they experience the bliss of serviceability of body and serviceability of mind, they are like the precious queen.

original: bsams pa'i don rnams 'grub pa ni //
analyzed: bsams pa'i don rnams 'grub pa ni //
translated: The accomplishment of intended goals

original: ting nge 'dzin las skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skye bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: arises from concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim bdag rin po che dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim bdag rin po che dang 'dra ste /
translated: The branch of enlightenment of concentration is like the precious minister of a universal monarch.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim bdag rin po ches 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos ji dang ji bsams pa dang ji dang ji 'dod pa thams cad bsams pa bzhin du 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyim bdag rin po ches 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos ji dang ji bsams pa dang ji dang ji 'dod pa thams cad bsams pa bzhin du 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the precious minister of a universal monarch accomplishes all that the universal monarch intends and all that he desires, just as he intends.

original: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa gang dang gang bsgrub par bsams pa de dang de @120b dag thams cad 'grub par byed pas khyim bdag rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa gang dang gang bsgrub par bsams pa de dang de @120b dag thams cad 'grub par byed pas khyim bdag rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: The limb of enlightenment of meditative concentration accomplishes whatever superknowledges one wishes for, such as the supernormal powers of the eye and ear, and so it is like the precious householder.üîΩ

original: ji ltar 'dod bzhin btang snyoms kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin btang snyoms kyis //
translated: The factor of enlightenment of meditative concentration also accomplishes whatever superknowledges one wishes to attain, such as the superknowledge of the divine eye and ear, and so on, and thus it is like the precious steward.

original: de dag kun du rab tu gnas //
analyzed: de dag kun du rab tu gnas //
translated: They always abideüîΩin equanimity as they wish.

original: rgyab nas thob dang mi rtogs la //üîΩgnas pas rtag tu mchog yin no //
analyzed: rgyab nas thob dang mi rtogs la // gnas pas rtag tu mchog yin no //
translated: They do not think about what they have obtained

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: or not obtained, and they are always supreme.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: The factor of enlightenment of equanimity is like the precious steward of the universal monarch.

original: de la btang snyoms kyi sgras ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms kyi sgras ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Here, the term equanimity refers to nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po ches pha rol gyi sde gzhom par bya ba'i phyir 'joms pa dang / nor dang rdzas la sogs pa rnams blang bar bya ba rnams sdud pa dang / bskrad par 'os pa rnams skrod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po ches pha rol gyi sde gzhom par bya ba'i phyir 'joms pa dang / nor dang rdzas la sogs pa rnams blang bar bya ba rnams sdud pa dang / bskrad par 'os pa rnams skrod par byed pa dang /
translated: Just as the precious universal emperor protects his subjects, conquers enemy armies, collects wealth and possessions and so on, expels those who should be expelled,

original: bskyang zhing bsdu bar 'os pa rnams sdud par byed pa dang / dmag gi dpung res 'khor nas 'gyed par byed pa rnams 'gyed par byed pa dang / res mi 'khor ba rnams sdud cing gtong bar byas na gnas gang du dmag gi dpung rnams 'tsho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: bskyang zhing bsdu bar 'os pa rnams sdud par byed pa dang / dmag gi dpung res 'khor nas 'gyed par byed pa rnams 'gyed par byed pa dang / res mi 'khor ba rnams sdud cing gtong bar byas na gnas gang du dmag gi dpung rnams 'tsho ba med pa dang /
translated: collects those who should be protected and gathered, sends out the army on rotation and gathers and sends back those who are not on rotation,

original: gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'i gnas der gnas par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'i gnas der gnas par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: he stays in places where the army is not without provisions and is not harmed.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gnas par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gnas par byed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas abide as they wish by means of two kinds of transcendent wisdom: nonconceptual transcendent wisdom and pure mundane transcendent wisdom attained subsequently to that.

original: de la yang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pas ni sa gong ma dang yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa rnams thob par byed la /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pas ni sa gong ma dang yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa rnams thob par byed la /
translated: Abiding in pure mundane transcendent wisdom, they attain the higher grounds and special qualities that they have not attained.

original: nyes pa ma spangs pa rnams ni spang bar byed cing sa 'og ma yang 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa ma spangs pa rnams ni spang bar byed cing sa 'og ma yang 'dor bar byed do //
translated: They abandon the faults that they have not abandoned and they leave behind the lower grounds.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni ci yang mi byed par gnas par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni ci yang mi byed par gnas par byed de /
translated: By means of nonconceptual transcendent wisdom, they abide without doing anything at all.

original: de bas na sa bcu kun du yang ye shes de gnyis la gnas pa ni gnas pa'i mchog yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sa bcu kun du yang ye shes de gnyis la gnas pa ni gnas pa'i mchog yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, on all the ten grounds, abiding in those two kinds of transcendent wisdom is explained as being the best kind of abiding.

original: de la gnas pas gzhan thob par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gnas pas gzhan thob par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Abiding in that, they attain what is to be attained and so on.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pas yon tan khyad par can dang / sa ma thob pa rnams thob par byed la /
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pas yon tan khyad par can dang / sa ma thob pa rnams thob par byed la /
translated: By abiding in pure mundane gnosis, one attains special qualities and the levels that have not been attained.

original: nyes pa dang skyon spang bar bya ba rnams ni spong bar byed do//üîΩrnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyes pa dang skyon spang bar bya ba rnams ni spong bar byed do// rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And one abandons the faults and defects that are to be abandoned.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni ci yang byed pa med par gnas te /üîΩdag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni blang bar bya ba blangs zin la spang bar bya ba spang zin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni blang dor cung zad kyang mi @121a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni ci yang byed pa med par gnas te / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni blang bar bya ba blangs zin la spang bar bya ba spang zin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni blang dor cung zad kyang mi @121a * //
translated: By means of nonconceptual gnosis, one abides without doing anything at all.

original: byed par 'bad pa dang brtsal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: byed par 'bad pa dang brtsal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas so //
translated: By means of pure mundane gnosis, one has already taken up what is to be taken up and abandoned what is to be abandoned. Therefore, by means of nonconceptual gnosis, one abides without the slightest effort or exertion, without taking up or abandoning anything.

original: gang du yan lag bzhi pa'i stobs kyi tshogs skyo bar mi 'gyur ba der song nas gnas par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang du yan lag bzhi pa'i stobs kyi tshogs skyo bar mi 'gyur ba der song nas gnas par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should understand that one goes to and abides in the place where the power of the four branches of yoga is not exhausted.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po ches rta'i tshogs dang / glang po'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs kyis gzhom zhing bskrad par bya ba rnams skrod par byed pa dang / bsdu zhing bskyang bar bya ba rnams sdud cing bskyang bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po kun mgon rin po ches rta'i tshogs dang / glang po'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs kyis gzhom zhing bskrad par bya ba rnams skrod par byed pa dang / bsdu zhing bskyang bar bya ba rnams sdud cing bskyang bar byas nas /
translated: The precious universal monarch, the protector of all, with his army of horses, his army of elephants, his army of chariots, and his army of infantry, drives out those who should be conquered and expelled, and he gathers and protects those who should be gathered and protected.

original: gnas gang du dmag sde bzhi rnams 'tshe ba med pa dang / gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i gnas der gnas par bya bar sems so //
analyzed: gnas gang du dmag sde bzhi rnams 'tshe ba med pa dang / gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i gnas der gnas par bya bar sems so //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI will live in a place where the four armies are not harmed and will not be harmed.‚Äù

original: de la dmag gi sde bzhis bsdu ba sdud pa dang / bskrad pa skrod par byed pa lta bu ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la dmag gi sde bzhis bsdu ba sdud pa dang / bskrad pa skrod par byed pa lta bu ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The gathering of those who should be gathered and the driving out of those who should be driven out by the four armies is the pure mundane gnosis.

original: dmag sde bzhi 'tshe ba med pa'i gnas su gnas pa lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dmag sde bzhi 'tshe ba med pa'i gnas su gnas pa lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Living in a place where the four armies are not harmed is the nonconceptual gnosis.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yon tan ldan //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yon tan ldan //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva who has these good qualities

original: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin //
translated: is like a universal monarch.

original: rtag tu byang chub yan lag bdun pos ni //
analyzed: rtag tu byang chub yan lag bdun pos ni //
translated: And always with the seven limbs of enlightenment,üîΩ

original: rin po che dang 'dra bas yongs su bskor //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bas yongs su bskor //
translated: Always surrounded by the seven riches of the factors of enlightenment.

original: zhes gong du bshad pa ltar na sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar gnas te /
analyzed: zhes gong du bshad pa ltar na sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar gnas te /
translated: As explained above, the bodhisattva who has entered the first ground is like a universal monarch endowed with the seven riches of the factors of enlightenment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che bdun dang ldan zhing rin po che bdun gyis bskor bde bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che bdun dang ldan zhing rin po che bdun gyis bskor bde bzhin du /
translated: For example, a universal monarch is endowed with the seven riches and is surrounded by the seven riches.

original: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang ldan zhing yan lag bdun gyis bskor bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang ldan zhing yan lag bdun gyis bskor bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang 'dra'o //
translated: Similarly, the bodhisattva who has entered the first ground is endowed with the seven factors of enlightenment and is surrounded by the seven factors, so he is like a universal monarch.üîΩThe branch of abode, the branch of nature,

original: gnas kyi yan lag rang bzhin yan lag dang // 'byung ba'i yan lag de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi yan lag rang bzhin yan lag dang // 'byung ba'i yan lag de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: and the third is the branch of emergence.

original: bzhi pa rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste //
translated: The fourth is the branch of subsequent praise.

original: nyon mongs med pa'i yan lag gsum gyi dngos //
analyzed: nyon mongs med pa'i yan lag gsum gyi dngos //
translated: The three limbs of non-affliction

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis /
translated: This verse shows

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun lngar sdud cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun lngar sdud cing /
translated: how the seven limbs of enlightenment are included in five,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa bstan te /
translated: and what the limbs of enlightenment are and how they are limbs of enlightenment.

original: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Here, mindfulness is called the limb of the basis.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The full appreciation of reality is called the limb of nature.

original: gsum pa brtson 'grus ni 'byung ba'i yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa brtson 'grus ni 'byung ba'i yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The third, vigor, is called the limb of origination.

original: bzhi pa dga' ba ni rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa dga' ba ni rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The fourth, joy, is called the limb of praise.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i @121b yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i @121b yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The three limbs of non-affliction are serenity, concentration, and equanimity.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the limb of enlightenment?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun nam chos rab tu 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun nam chos rab tu 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The seven limbs of enlightenment or the full appreciation of reality are the limb of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar yan lag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they branches?

original: dran pa ni gnas pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa nas btang snyoms la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnas pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa nas btang snyoms la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag tu gyur pas so //
translated: Mindfulness is the branch of stability, and equanimity, etc. are the branches of non-affliction.

original: thams cad de la brten zhing 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad de la brten zhing 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because all of them are based on it and operate in dependence on it.

original: dran pa ni gnas pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni gnas pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the branch of stability.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it the branch of stability?

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad ni dran pa la brten zhing dran pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad ni dran pa la brten zhing dran pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the virtues such as the discrimination of phenomena are based on mindfulness and arise from mindfulness.üîΩEnlightenment is its own branch because it is its very nature.

original: byang chub de nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub de nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: The discrimination of phenomena is called the branch of nature.

original: byang chub ces bya ba yang chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar byed cing shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba yang chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar byed cing shes pa la bya ste /
translated: Enlightenment is also called the non-erroneous discrimination of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang chos rab tu 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag tu gzhug go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang chos rab tu 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag tu gzhug go //
translated: Since the nature of enlightenment also has the nature of discernment of phenomena, discernment of phenomena is included as the natural branch.

original: de mthar thug pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de mthar thug pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it causes the attainment of the culmination.

original: brtson 'grus ni 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Effort is the branch of origination,

original: brtson 'grus kyis ji srid du bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su phyin gyi bar du 'gro zhing ma phyin gyi bar du bar ma dor mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ji srid du bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su phyin gyi bar du 'gro zhing ma phyin gyi bar du bar ma dor mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes by means of effort to the place to be gone as far as it extends, and does not stop short in the interval.

original: sems bde ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bde ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it makes the mind happy.

original: dga' ba de rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba de rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the branch of praise,

original: chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'i sgo nas dga' ba de sems la dga' ba'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'i sgo nas dga' ba de sems la dga' ba'i khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that joy, by means of seeing the realm of the Dharma, produces a special happiness in the mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Serenity, concentration, and equanimity.

original: chos de gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos de gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: These three dharmas are called the branch of non-affliction.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ce na /
translated: How are they the branch of non-affliction?

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa med par byed pa dang / gang la gnas na nyon mongs pa med par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa med par byed pa dang / gang la gnas na nyon mongs pa med par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are the means by which one becomes unafflicted, the basis on which one becomes unafflicted, and the state of being unafflicted.

original: de la gang gis nyon mongs pa med par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la gang gis nyon mongs pa med par byed ce na /
translated: What is the means by which one becomes unafflicted?

original: shin tu sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa med par byed de /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa med par byed de /
translated: One becomes unafflicted through pliancy,

original: lus dang sems las su rung bar gyur na des lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung bar gyur na des lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when body and mind become serviceable, one does not engage in the unserviceability of body and mind, the negative reflex actions of affliction and the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: gang la gnas nas nyon mongs pa med par byed ce na /üîΩting nge 'dzin la gnas nas nyon mongs pa med par byed de /
analyzed: gang la gnas nas nyon mongs pa med par byed ce na / ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas nyon mongs pa med par byed de /
translated: On what basis does one become unafflicted?üîΩOne becomes unafflicted on the basis of concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas @122a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas @122a * //
translated: because one becomes unafflicted through the power of concentration.

original: pa'i dus na zhum rgod kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i dus na zhum rgod kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it eliminates the secondary afflictions of discouragement and excitement.

original: gang nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the absence of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang btang snyoms gnyis su 'gal bas btang snyoms la gnas pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang btang snyoms gnyis su 'gal bas btang snyoms la gnas pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one is abiding in equanimity, there is not the slightest opportunity for the arising of afflictions, since afflictions and equanimity are mutually exclusive.

original: lam gyi yan lag dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the members of the path.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the seven members of enlightenment and the explanation of the eightfold noble path that follows?

original: sa dang po mthong ba'i lam du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms pas mthong bas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
analyzed: sa dang po mthong ba'i lam du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms pas mthong bas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing by cultivating the seven members of enlightenment on the path of seeing in the first stage,

original: de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to abandon the afflictions and objective obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad bsgom pa'i lam na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa de bas ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad bsgom pa'i lam na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa de bas ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad bshad par 'brel to //
translated: The eightfold noble path is explained as the noble path's members, following the seven members of enlightenment, because it is cultivated on the path of cultivation from the second to the tenth stages.

original: de la lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: de la lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: The eight members of the path are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort,

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam na chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa de nyid la dmigs shing bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam na chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa de nyid la dmigs shing bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Right view is the cultivation of the very same realization of the selflessness of persons and things by means of the member of enlightenment of the analysis of things on the path of insight.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra also says,

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is right view?

original: gang 'di 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
analyzed: gang 'di 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
translated: It is the noble transcendent wisdom

original: bdag tu lta ba las blangs pa ma yin srog tu ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba las blangs pa ma yin srog tu ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: that does not take up the view of a self, a being, a life-force, and so on.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba des rgyu byas nas khams gsum las byung ba'i rgyu lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rtog cing 'dod pa dang / gnod sems la rtog pa spangs na 'dod pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba des rgyu byas nas khams gsum las byung ba'i rgyu lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rtog cing 'dod pa dang / gnod sems la rtog pa spangs na 'dod pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having been caused by that right view, one investigates the causes that arise from the three realms, and one wishes for the superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom. If one abandons the investigation of malice, one wishes for and abandons the investigation of malice. The investigation of non-malice is called right investigation.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra also says,

original: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is right investigation?

original: rtog pa gang gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i kun du rtog pa de la mi rtog go //
analyzed: rtog pa gang gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i kun du rtog pa de la mi rtog go //
translated: He does not think about the thoughts that give rise to the afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance.üîΩHe does think about the thoughts that give rise to the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rtog pa gang gis tshul @122b khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rtog pa de dag la rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: Right mindfulness is cultivated as the antidote to the obscurations of karma.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni khyad par can gyi yon tan gyi sgrib pa'i gnyen por bsgom mo //üîΩbyang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams kyi 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni khyad par can gyi yon tan gyi sgrib pa'i gnyen por bsgom mo // byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams kyi 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Right concentration is cultivated as the antidote to the obscurations to the special qualities.

original: sa dang por byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom ste /
analyzed: sa dang por byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom ste /
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are cultivated on the first stage.

original: de'i 'og tu sa gnyis pa yan chad na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa gnyis pa yan chad na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la bsgom mo //
translated: The eightfold noble path is cultivated on the second and subsequent stages.

original: de la yang chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa'i chos de nyid la lta zhing de nyid kyi don khong du chud pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa'i chos de nyid la lta zhing de nyid kyi don khong du chud pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, by means of the factor of enlightenment that is perfect discernment, one views the reality that is understood as the selflessness of the person and of phenomena, and the understanding of that reality is called right view.

original: shes pa de rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: shes pa de rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement having established that knowledge, etc.

original: shes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the understanding of reality by the Bhagavat.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis gsungs te 'jig rten du gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis gsungs te 'jig rten du gzhag pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures, the establishment of the world.

original: yang na chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis chos kyi don ji ltar khong du chud pa ni shes pa de rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chos rab tu 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis chos kyi don ji ltar khong du chud pa ni shes pa de rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the establishment of that knowledge is called the discernment of phenomena, which is the branch of enlightenment. The meaning of the term discernment of phenomena is the understanding of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: de la gang bdag gis de kho na nyid khong du chud pas yang nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i las byas pas khong du chud do zhes rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang bdag gis de kho na nyid khong du chud pas yang nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i las byas pas khong du chud do zhes rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The correct thought is the thought that one has understood reality by oneself, and that one has understood it through the activity of listening, reflection, and meditation, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes pa ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes pa ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat has taught refers to the teaching of the Bhagavat, the twelve branches of the scriptures, the sutra, etc.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang de @124b kho na khong du chud par bya ba de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang de @124b kho na khong du chud par bya ba de 'byung ngo //
translated: And it is from the Sutras and so on that one should understand reality.

original: des ni de'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni de'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of that, one understands its meaning.

original: des zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa des so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa des so //
translated: Because of that means because of right thought.

original: de'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta bas de khon na nyid sngar khong du chud nas yang dag pa'i rtog pas kyang gsung rab kyi don rnams khong du chud de mngon sum du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyang dag pa'i rtsol bas yun ring por mi skyo bar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta bas de khon na nyid sngar khong du chud nas yang dag pa'i rtog pas kyang gsung rab kyi don rnams khong du chud de mngon sum du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // yang dag pa'i rtsol bas yun ring por mi skyo bar zhes bya ba la /
translated: Understanding its meaning means that, having previously understood reality through right view, one also understands the meaning of the scriptures through right thought, and sees it directly.üîΩThrough right effort, one meditates for a long time without weariness, and thus abandons the obscurations to omniscience.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtsol bas yun ring por mi skyo bar bsgoms pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtsol bas yun ring por mi skyo bar bsgoms pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, one abandons the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por bsgom mo //üîΩyang dag pa'i dran pas ni zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por bsgom mo // yang dag pa'i dran pas ni zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, right effort is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to omniscience.üîΩRight mindfulness is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.

original: lam bsgom pa ni zhum pa dang rgod pa spang ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pas zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dag yid la byas nas zhum pa dang rgod pa spangs te /üîΩzhum pa dang rgod pa med par 'phags pa'i lam la bsgom pas na /

translated: The practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.
