translated: The practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.üîΩThe practice of the path is to be practiced as the antidote to the obscurations to the path.

original: de la nam zhum pa byung ba'i tshe na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa sems gzengs bstod par 'gyur ba rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byas nas zhum pa sel bar byed do //üîΩnam sems rgod par 'gyur ba'i dus na sems zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la nam zhum pa byung ba'i tshe na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa sems gzengs bstod par 'gyur ba rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byas nas zhum pa sel bar byed do // nam sems rgod par 'gyur ba'i dus na sems zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: When slackness occurs, one should eliminate it by attending to the signs of the object of meditation that is the cause of mental exhilaration, such as the good qualities of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon yid la byed pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas rgod pa med par byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon yid la byed pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas rgod pa med par byed do //
translated: When the mind is agitated, one should eliminate it by attending to the signs of mental tranquility, such as the faults of cyclic existence.

original: nam zhum pa dang rgod pa dang bral ba'i dus na btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems mi skyo bar 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: nam zhum pa dang rgod pa dang bral ba'i dus na btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems mi skyo bar 'jog par byed do //
translated: When the mind is free from slackness and agitation, one should attend to the signs of equanimity and rest in a state of mental non-exertion.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The signs of the object of meditation for the four kinds of attention are explained in the ≈örƒÅvakabh≈´mi:üîΩWhat is the sign of the object of meditation for the one-pointed mind?

original: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa dang bgeg  rnams bsal par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu sems rtse gcig par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa dang bgeg  rnams bsal par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu sems rtse gcig par 'jog ste /
translated: In order to attain the special qualities such as the magical eye, etc., and in order to remove the obscurations and hindrances that are obstacles to that attainment, one should always settle the mind in right concentration, in a single area.

original: rtse gcig tu gzhag na yon tan khyad par can thob pa la sgrib pa'i bar du gcod pa dang bral nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can thob par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rtse gcig tu gzhag na yon tan khyad par can thob pa la sgrib pa'i bar du gcod pa dang bral nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: If one settles it in a single area, one becomes free of the obscurations and hindrances that are obstacles to the attainment of the special qualities.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni @125a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni @125a * //
translated: Therefore, right concentration

original: khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon du sgrub pa la sgrib pa'i gnyen po bsgom par gzhag go //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon du sgrub pa la sgrib pa'i gnyen po bsgom par gzhag go //
translated: is to be settled in the cultivation of the antidote to the obscurations that hinder the realization of the special qualities.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three verses on the analysis of serenity and insight.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi 'og tu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi 'og tu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the aids to enlightenment and the section on serenity and insight that follows it?üîΩSerenity and insight are the means for accomplishing all the aids to enlightenment.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs thams cad grub par byed pa'i thabs yin te byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa thams cad la /üîΩzhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni med du mi rung la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs thams cad grub par byed pa'i thabs yin te byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa thams cad la / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni med du mi rung la /
translated: They are indispensable for all the practices of the aids to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi skabs su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bshad zin mod kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi skabs su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bshad zin mod kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par bstan te /
translated: Although serenity and insight have already been explained in the section on the aids to enlightenment, they must be taught again without confusing their individual characteristics.

original: da zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di /
analyzed: da zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di /
translated: The characteristics of serenity are as follows.

original: lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid ni 'di'o zhes ma 'dres par bstan dgos te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid ni 'di'o zhes ma 'dres par bstan dgos te /
translated: The characteristics of insight are as follows.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi 'og tu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi 'og tu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the section on serenity and insight is connected to the section on the aids to enlightenment.

original: sems la sems ni gzhag pa dang // chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa dang // yang dag gnas la nyer gnas pa //
analyzed: sems la sems ni gzhag pa dang // chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa dang // yang dag gnas la nyer gnas pa //
translated: and abiding in the authentic state

original: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong ngo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are serenity and insight.

original: yang dag par gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /
translated: The authentic state is authentic concentration.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi la brten nas /
translated: Based on the four uncontaminated concentrations of the form realm,

original: sems la sems gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sems la sems gzhag pa ste /
translated: you place the mind on the mind.

original: khams gsum thams cad ni sems tsam du zad pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad ni sems tsam du zad pa ste /
translated: The three realms are nothing but the mind.üîΩThere is nothing other than the mind.

original: sems las gzhan med do zhes sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las gzhan med do zhes sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Placing the mind one-pointedly in this way is called serenity.

original: de tsam gyis na zhi gnas yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na zhi gnas yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: This much is the completion of serenity.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnyed na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnyed na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab 'byung ste /
translated: When you have attained mental equipoise, the wisdom that knows things as they are will arise.

original: chos gang rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos gang rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: Nonconceptual wisdom that unmistakenly knows the meaning of any phenomenon is called insight.

original: 'di dag ni theg pa chen po'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid mdor bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni theg pa chen po'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid mdor bstan to //
translated: These are the brief definitions of the calming and discerning of the Great Vehicle.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said:

original: de la zhi gnas mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the inexhaustibility of calming?üîΩIt is the calming of the mind, the complete calming of the mind, the pacification of the mind, and so on.

original: gang sems zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang sems zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the inexhaustibility of discerning?

original: gang shes rab kyi cha'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi cha'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is the path of cultivation of the side of wisdom.

original: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / sems can med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / sems can med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the non-movement of things, the knowledge of their ownerlessness, the knowledge of their non-sentience, and so on.

original: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of calming and discerning.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of calming and discerning, it is said:

original: de dag kun du rab tu 'gro //
analyzed: de dag kun du rab tu 'gro //
translated: They are the universal, the special,

original: @125b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @125b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and the distinguished.

original: de dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba la bya ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúthose‚Äù refer to serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob par 'dod pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thob par 'dod pa de dag kun gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom dgos te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob par 'dod pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thob par 'dod pa de dag kun gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom dgos te /
translated: Those who wish to cultivate the factors of enlightenment, attain the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments, and attain the superknowledges and so forth, must cultivate serenity and insight.

original: yon tan sgrub pa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong med du mi rung bas na /
analyzed: yon tan sgrub pa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong med du mi rung bas na /
translated: Because serenity and insight are indispensable for achieving good qualities,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //üîΩcha gcig cha med rgyur 'dod de //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o // cha gcig cha med rgyur 'dod de //
translated: they are called ‚Äúuniversal.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang gi tshe zhi gnas 'ba' zhig bsgom gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang gi tshe zhi gnas 'ba' zhig bsgom gyi /
translated: One part, partless, are asserted as causes.

original: lhag mthong shas chung ba de na yang cha gcig la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong shas chung ba de na yang cha gcig la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one cultivates only serenity and insight is weak, that is called ‚Äúcultivation of one part.

original: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is like the cultivation of the formless meditative attainments.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni zhi gnas shas che la lhag mthong shas chung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni zhi gnas shas che la lhag mthong shas chung ngo //
translated: In the formless meditative attainments, serenity predominates and insight is slight.

original: gang gi tshe lhag mthong 'ba' zhig bsgom la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lhag mthong 'ba' zhig bsgom la /
translated: When you cultivate only insight,

original: zhi gnas shas chung ba de yang cha gcig la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas shas chung ba de yang cha gcig la bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and serenity is slight, that is called ‚Äúcultivation in one part.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams kyis ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la bsgom pa'o //üîΩde gsum gyi dus na lhag mthong shas che la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams kyis ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la bsgom pa'o // de gsum gyi dus na lhag mthong shas che la /
translated: Thus, in the form realm, you cultivate serenity and insight in the first, second, and third meditative stabilizations.

original: zhi gnas shas chung ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas shas chung ngo //
translated: At the time of those three, insight predominates and serenity is slight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par bsgom pa ni cha med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par bsgom pa ni cha med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When serenity and insight are cultivated in combination, that is called ‚Äúcultivation without distinction.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi pa la bsgom pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi pa la bsgom pa'i dus na'o //

analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i cha'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la ni rgyur 'dod pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas /

original: ae ma'i dge slong dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po thob par 'dod pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya ba nas bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thob par 'dod pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pas na kun du 'gro ba yin no /

translated: ‚ÄúOne who wishes to attain the second, third, and fourth concentrations and the superknowledges and so on should cultivate serenity and insight.‚ÄùüîΩSince it says this, serenity and insight are universal.

original: rab tu rtogs dang zhes bya ba la /

original: sa dang po'i zhi gnas dang lhag ma thob @126a * //
analyzed: sa dang po'i zhi gnas dang lhag ma thob @126a * //
translated: And on the second to tenth stages, it is called the cultivation of the aids to liberation.üîΩOn the first stage, it is called the cultivation of the aids to penetration.

original: la ni rab tu rtogs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ste /üîΩde'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: sa bdun pa'i dus na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i dus na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the aids to the special insight of the disciple and hermit buddha is the cultivation of the aids to the special insight of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe cultivation of the aids to the special insight of the bodhisattva is the cultivation of the aids to the special insight of the tathagata.

original: de'i dus na mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs la mtshan ma tha dad par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i dus na mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs la mtshan ma tha dad par mi byed kyi /

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni brtsal ba dang 'bad pa med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la gnas pa'i phyir ro //

translated: the calm abiding and insight of the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages are called ‚Äúpurified‚Äù because they purify the Buddha-land, making it the color of crystal, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib ba'i bag la nyal tshun chad spangs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par byed pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib ba'i bag la nyal tshun chad spangs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par byed pas na /

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúpurification‚Äù because it causes one to attain Buddhahood, which is the abandonment of even the latent states of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba'o //

translated: Therefore, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines also says, ‚ÄúIf you wish to perfect the perfection of generosity, you should train in the perfection of wisdom.
